description:
Questrade Financial Group (QFG), through its companies \- Questrade, Inc., Questrade Wealth Management Inc., Community Trust Company, Zolo, and Flexiti Financial Inc., provides securities and foreign currency investment, professionally managed investment portfolios, mortgages, real estate services, financial services and more. Questrade uses cutting\-edge technologies to develop innovative products that give customers better, more affordable ways to take control of their money.
  
  

We are everything a traditional financial institution is not. At QFG, you will be constantly moving forward, bringing the future of fintech into existence. You will be a part of a collaborative team that cares deeply about our mission and each other. Your team members will help you conquer challenges, push boundaries and discover what you are truly capable of.
  
  

At QFG, we have a culture of innovation where technology serves people—both our team and our customers. We see AI as a collaborative and transformative enabler, and we are seeking forward\-thinking individuals who can effectively integrate it into their daily work. The ideal candidate will be a catalyst for change, helping us use AI to create a more efficient and rewarding employee experience while also developing cutting\-edge solutions that delight and serve our customers. Join us in shaping a future where AI empowers our team to do their best work and helps us deliver unparalleled customer experiences.
  
This is a place where you can explore, discover and learn with continuous growth. As a diverse and inclusive place to work, with a hybrid working environment you can unleash your creativity and curiosity with no limits. If you share the same sense of infinite possibility, come shape your future at QFG.
  
  

What’s in it for you as an employee of QFG?
  
* Health \& wellbeing resources and programs
* Paid vacation, personal, and sick days for work\-life balance
* Competitive compensation and benefits packages
* Work\-life balance in a hybrid environment with at least 3 days in office
* Career growth and development opportunities
* Opportunities to contribute to community causes
* Work with diverse team members in an inclusive and collaborative environment


We’re looking for our next Senior BI Analyst. Could It Be You?
  
The purpose of this role is to conduct deep\-dive analyses to identify process improvements, drive automation to streamline data workflows, collaborate with cross\-functional teams to deliver actionable insights, while ensuring data integrity through the development and maintenance of robust models and processes.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
This role focuses on enhancing operational efficiency and driving data\-driven decision\-making through deep\-dive analysis and process improvement. Key responsibilities include identifying and implementing automation solutions to streamline workflows, collaborating with cross\-functional teams to understand reporting needs, and delivering actionable insights. The role also involves developing and maintaining data models to support analytics initiatives while ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data across various systems.
  
  

So are YOU our next Senior BI Analyst? You are if you…
  
* Conduct deep dive analysis to identify process improvements and efficiencies.
* Identify opportunities for process automation to streamline data collection and reporting workflows.
* Implement automation solutions to enhance efficiency and reduce manual intervention.
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to understand reporting requirements and provide actionable insights.
* Develop and maintain data models to support reporting and analytics initiatives.
* Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across various datasets.


Key Competencies
  
  

* Technical: Highly proficient in SQL, Python / R, Power BI, Databricks
* Detail Oriented: Always seeking accuracy in all reports and analysis
* Analytical Thinking: Ability to perform in\-depth analyses to uncover inefficiencies and opportunities for improvement.
* Collaboration and Communication: Capability to work effectively with cross\-functional teams and communicate insights clearly


Additional Information…
  
* 2\+ years experience in data analytics, business intelligence, or related field
* Bachelors Degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics or Computer Engineering
* Technical Skills: Highly proficient in SQL, Power BI, Python/R is a plus


**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $70,000 \- $90,000
* The final compensation package will be commensurated with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.


Sounds like you? Click below to apply! LI\-DM1 \#LI\-Hybrid
  
  

At Questrade Financial Group of Companies, with multiple office locations around the world, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive and accessible work environment. This is an environment where individuals are treated with dignity and respect. Here, the unique skills and experience you bring will be valued. You will be supported and motivated, so that you can harness your unlimited potential. Our team reflects the diversity of the communities we serve and operate in. Having a collaborative and diverse team helps us push boundaries to bring the future of fintech into existence—not only for the benefit of our customers, but for those who build their career with us.
  
  

Questrade Financial Group of companies Applicant Tracking System utilizes artificial intelligence (AI) for application screening. The AI system operates on predetermined criteria, with final decisions subject to human review.
  
  

Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment/selection process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
title: Senior BI Analyst, Business Intelligence & Automation

We’re looking for our next Director, Financial Planning and Analysis. Could it be you?
  
Reporting to the CFO, the Director of Financial Planning and Analysis is a high\-impact role at the company. This role will serve as a trusted advisor to business leaders, driving alignment across the enterprise and providing critical insights into profitability and growth.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading...
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
* Strategic Planning \& Modeling: Leading the end\-to\-end corporate planning process, including annual budgeting, in\-year forecasting, and long\-range (5\-year) strategic modeling.
* Business Performance Management: Designing, monitoring, and managing Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) at the line\-of\-business and product levels to drive profitability and cost efficiency.
* Decision Support \& Analysis: Developing frameworks to evaluate new products, strategic initiatives, merchant relationships, and growth opportunities. Provide deep profitability analysis and actionable advice to executive leadership.
* Treasury Partnership: Collaborating with the Treasury function on capital and debt management strategies, hedging, balance sheet optimization, and financial risk management.
* Reporting \& Insights: Overseeing monthly management reporting and expense analysis. Presenting financial results, operational insights, and variance analysis (vs. plan/prior year) to the Executive Team and Board of Directors.
* Lending \& Risk Integration: Incorporating specific lending metrics, including Expected Credit Loss (ECL) and Provision for Credit Losses (PCL), into financial models and forecasts.
* Team Leadership: Managing, coaching, and developing a team of finance professionals. Fostering a culture of high performance and continuous improvement.
* Process Optimization: Championing the automation and streamlining of existing financial processes to enhance efficiency and data accuracy.


So are YOU our next Director, Financial Planning and Analysis? You are, if you...
  
* Hold a University degree in Accounting or Finance;
* Hold a relevant professional designation (CPA, CFA or MBA)
* Have 10\+ years of progressive finance experience, with 5\+ years in FP\&A within the Financial Services or Corporate Lending sectors
* Possess a deep understanding of lending economics, including ECL/PCL methodologies
* Have advanced proficiency in financial modeling and G\-Suite (Google Workspace)
* Bring exceptional analytical and problem\-solving abilities with a focus on data\-driven decision\-making
* Have strong organizational skills with the ability to manage competing priorities and deadlines with precision


Sounds like you? Click below to apply!
  
\#LI\-DD1
  
\#LI\-Hybrid

We’re looking for a Treasurer. Could It Be You?
  
The Treasurer reports directly to the Brokerage Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and is responsible for centralized Treasury management and the enterprise\-wide financial risk framework (including liquidity, interest rate, and foreign exchange risk). This role provides strategic direction, oversight, and counsel on all matters related to corporate funding, cash management, short\-term investments, and the group's overall capital plan, ensuring adherence to internal controls and regulatory compliance.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
The Treasurer's responsibilities involve strategic oversight, leadership, and execution across the enterprise:
  
* Capital \& Funding Strategy: Develop and execute the enterprise\-wide capital management strategy, funding plans, and debt management activities. Oversee the day\-to\-day running and optimization of the group's funding structure across all entities.
* Financial Risk Management: Establish and maintain a Brokerage wide financial risk management framework for liquidity, interest rate risk (IRR), and foreign exchange (FOREX) exposure.
* Liquidity \& Investment: Provide strategic direction for the management of corporate cash and short\-term investments to maximize returns while maintaining required regulatory and operational liquidity
* Relationship Management: Lead strategic relationships with banks, and financial institutions, maintaining all bank mandates and corporate accounts.
* Strategic Input: Provide expert Treasury input into the corporate financial budgeting, forecasting processes , and assist in producing funding plans for new business ventures and/or acquisitions.
* Team Leadership: Lead, mentor, and manage the Treasury team, including the Director, Treasury Operations, ensuring effective performance management and talent development.
* Operational Excellence: Direct the implementation and maintenance of robust Treasury Management Systems (TMS) and internal controls, recommending and implementing improvements to cash management processes.


So are YOU our next Treasurer? You are if you…
  
* Hold a university degree in Finance, Business, or a related field. An MBA, CFA, or CPA designation is strongly preferred.
* Have a minimum of 12\-15 years of progressively senior experience within a Treasury function, with significant experience in a Broker\-Dealer or regulated financial services environment managing cash, debt, and investments \[Elevated from 10\+ years in ].
* Have extensive knowledge of capital markets, funding programs, and asset/liability management (ALM) principles.
* Hold a Certified Treasury Professional (CTP) designation ( highly desirable).
* Have In\-depth knowledge of the Canadian securities industry, including IIROC rules and regulations. Sound understanding of regulatory requirements related to liquidity and risk management for a deposit\-taking institution (given the focus on CTC in ).
* Have demonstrated ability to develop long\-term capital and risk strategies that align with the firm’s growth objectives.
* Have strong influencing, negotiation, and communication skills sufficient to present and defend complex financial strategies to the CFO, CEO, Board, and external partners.
* Have a deep expertise in managing financial market risks (Liquidity, Interest Rate, FOREX) in a regulated environment.
* Have proven experience in managing, developing, and motivating a high\-performing financial team.
* Have proven ability to partner with internal stakeholders such as Brokerage Operations, Technology, and Legal to optimize workflows and processes.

We’re looking for our next Senior Fraud Investigator. Could it be you?
  
The Fraud Risk Management team is accountable to proactively, comprehensively combat fraud for all of Questrade Financial Group (“QFG”); to help Canadians become much more financially successful and secure.
  
The Senior Fraud Investigator will be required to assist in a variety of investigations such as internal fraud, merchant fraud, merchant employee fraud, payment fraud etc. The Senior Fraud Investigator will proactively combat fraud by applying advanced investigation techniques to enhance fraud mitigation capabilities for all products and services across the organization.
  
Reporting to the Supervisor and/or Fraud Manager, this role is responsible for conducting an investigative analysis on all types of fraud to identify, assess, determine and report on activity that indicates an exposure to financial crimes to mitigate financial and/or reputational risk to QFG and our customers. The Senior Fraud Investigator will also outline key fraud risks, gaps and provide recommendations, and drive program enhancements. Working closely with internal, external partners and clients when conducting investigations.
  
  

This position will be a 6\-month contract.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading...
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
* Developing solutions and making recommendations based on investigations and understanding of business strategy and stakeholder needs.
* Conducting independent analysis and assessment to resolve current investigations, identify root causes, quantify risk exposure and reduce future fraud incidents.
* Supporting the merchant onboarding/review process by providing fraud based recommendations to SalesOps.
* Building effective relationships with internal / external stakeholders (e.g. law enforcement agencies and other Financial Institutions to collaborate in investigations).
* Integrating information from multiple sources to enable more efficient processes, enhanced analysis and/or streamlined reporting.
* Analyzing and assessing incidents and cases that may be complex and require knowledge on several different product lines.
* Ability to conduct in\-depth reviews and thorough link\-analysis.
* Analyzing data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
* Monitoring and analyzing various information provided through detection systems, tools, reports, or manually to evaluate, investigate and determine required actions.
* Documenting actions and information found throughout the investigation to develop and maintain account/case files.
* Developing and maintaining an understanding of the financial crime management processes, frameworks and techniques.
* Providing input and developing recommendations for process and customer service improvements.
* Preparing reports, notifications and activity / case filings to upper management or as required.
* Staying abreast of financial crimes risk trends, relevant regulations and compliance standards.
* Supporting the collection of evidence and information to be used for multiple purposes including incident reports/filings, loss prevention, litigation and criminal prosecution, management information and statistics, and process improvements.
* Exercising judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems.
* Providing guidance, training and awareness to the organization (including Fraud Investigators) to ensure they adhere to best practices and industry standards.
* Other duties or accountabilities as needed.


So are YOU our next Senior Fraud Investigator? You are, if you...
  
* Hold a University degree in business, statistics or criminology
* Have 3\-5 years of experience relating to mortgage and lending fraud
* Have in\-depth knowledge of risk and technology management as applied to fraud and/or criminal risk
* Are a seasoned professional with a combination of education, experience and industry knowledge
* Have strong analytical skills relating to a wide variety of banking and investment products and services
* Have a solid understanding of lending underwriting and other lending products
* Have strong analytical and problem solving and investigation skills
* Have excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Are self\-motivated, energetic and results\-oriented, committed to adding value to the organization
* Are proficient in Google Suite Products (Sheets, Docs, Slides)


Additional kudos if you…
  
* Have knowledge of banking products, services, and processes
* Are a certified Fraud Examiner (CFE) or Certified Financial Crime Specialist (CFCS)


Additional Information…
  
* Operating hours are 8 am to 9 pm, Monday to Sunday
* Shifts will be scheduled 5 days per week, not exceeding 40 hours in total


**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $65,000 \- $70,000
* The final compensation package will be commensurated with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.

We’re looking for our next Senior Fraud Investigator. Could it be you?
  
The Fraud Risk Management team is accountable to proactively, comprehensively combat fraud for all of Questrade Financial Group (“QFG”); to help Canadians become much more financially successful and secure.
  
The Senior Fraud Investigator will be required to assist in a variety of investigations such as internal fraud, merchant fraud, merchant employee fraud, payment fraud etc. The Senior Fraud Investigator will proactively combat fraud by applying advanced investigation techniques to enhance fraud mitigation capabilities for all products and services across the organization.
  
Reporting to the Supervisor and/or Fraud Manager, this role is responsible for conducting an investigative analysis on all types of fraud to identify, assess, determine and report on activity that indicates an exposure to financial crimes to mitigate financial and/or reputational risk to QFG and our customers. The Senior Fraud Investigator will also outline key fraud risks, gaps and provide recommendations, and drive program enhancements. Working closely with internal, external partners and clients when conducting investigations.
  
  

This position will be a 6\-month contract.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading...
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
* Developing solutions and making recommendations based on investigations and understanding of business strategy and stakeholder needs.
* Conducting independent analysis and assessment to resolve current investigations, identify root causes, quantify risk exposure and reduce future fraud incidents.
* Supporting the merchant onboarding/review process by providing fraud based recommendations to SalesOps.
* Building effective relationships with internal / external stakeholders (e.g. law enforcement agencies and other Financial Institutions to collaborate in investigations).
* Integrating information from multiple sources to enable more efficient processes, enhanced analysis and/or streamlined reporting.
* Analyzing and assessing incidents and cases that may be complex and require knowledge on several different product lines.
* Ability to conduct in\-depth reviews and thorough link\-analysis.
* Analyzing data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
* Monitoring and analyzing various information provided through detection systems, tools, reports, or manually to evaluate, investigate and determine required actions.
* Documenting actions and information found throughout the investigation to develop and maintain account/case files.
* Developing and maintaining an understanding of the financial crime management processes, frameworks and techniques.
* Providing input and developing recommendations for process and customer service improvements.
* Preparing reports, notifications and activity / case filings to upper management or as required.
* Staying abreast of financial crimes risk trends, relevant regulations and compliance standards.
* Supporting the collection of evidence and information to be used for multiple purposes including incident reports/filings, loss prevention, litigation and criminal prosecution, management information and statistics, and process improvements.
* Exercising judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems.
* Providing guidance, training and awareness to the organization (including Fraud Investigators) to ensure they adhere to best practices and industry standards.
* Other duties or accountabilities as needed.


So are YOU our next Senior Fraud Investigator? You are, if you...
  
* Hold a University degree in business, statistics or criminology
* Have 3\-5 years of experience relating to mortgage and lending fraud
* Have in\-depth knowledge of risk and technology management as applied to fraud and/or criminal risk
* Are a seasoned professional with a combination of education, experience and industry knowledge
* Have strong analytical skills relating to a wide variety of banking and investment products and services
* Have a solid understanding of lending underwriting and other lending products
* Have strong analytical and problem solving and investigation skills
* Have excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Are self\-motivated, energetic and results\-oriented, committed to adding value to the organization
* Are proficient in Google Suite Products (Sheets, Docs, Slides)


Additional kudos if you…
  
* Have knowledge of banking products, services, and processes
* Are a certified Fraud Examiner (CFE) or Certified Financial Crime Specialist (CFCS)


Additional Information…
  
* Operating hours are 8 am to 9 pm, Monday to Sunday
* Shifts will be scheduled 5 days per week, not exceeding 40 hours in total


**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $65,000 \- $70,000
* The final compensation package will be commensurated with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.

We’re looking for our next Manager, Finance Systems \& Processes. Could it be you?
  
The purpose of the Manager, Finance Systems \& Processes role is to optimize and maintain core Finance systems and processes, ensuring efficiency, accuracy, and compliance.
  
The Manager will be responsible to drive continuous improvement initiatives, ensuring efficient, accurate, and compliant Finance operations. The role will collaborate closely with Finance stakeholders, IT, and other departments to identify opportunities for automation, standardization, and enhanced data integrity. This role requires a strong understanding of finance principles, system functionalities, and process improvement methodologies, coupled with excellent business analysis, project management and communication skills. The ideal candidate will play a critical role in supporting strategic finance initiatives and will be a proactive problem\-solver with a passion for leveraging technology to drive financial excellence.
  
The Manager will report to the Director, Finance Systems and Transformation and will work closely with cross\-functional teams, stakeholders, and senior management to achieve Finance project objectives.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading...
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
  

**Stakeholder Management:**  

* Collaborating with stakeholders across Finance, Technology, Risk and Business operations to scope, plan, and execute Questbank and Enterprise\-wide projects.
* Managing relationships with external and internal auditors, vendors and consultants, and other key stakeholders and act as a primary point of contact for queries on Finance and Accounting projects/processes.
* Communicating effectively with stakeholders at all levels.
* Managing stakeholder expectations and ensuring alignment on project goals.


**Business and Process Analysis:**  

* Identifying and implementing process improvements within the finance department.
* Translating business requirements into functional specifications and user stories.
* Assisting in the implementation of new systems and tools, ensuring alignment with business processes.
* Facilitating workshops, interviews and walkthrough sessions with stakeholders to gather insights.
* Contributing to the development of standard operating procedures and project documentation.
* Providing training to finance team members on new system functionalities and offer ongoing support post\-implementation.
* Monitoring industry trends and regulatory developments to inform finance transformation roadmaps.


**Project Management:**  

* Managing finance projects from initiation to closure.
* Developing project plans, including timelines, budgets, and resource allocation.
* Monitoring project progress and provide regular status updates to the Director, Finance Systems, stakeholders and project governance forums.
* Identifying and mitigating project risks and issues.


**Production Support:**  

* Working closely with the team to understand the new/existing system issues or issues related to Projects.
* Maintaining an issue log and periodically updating the management with the progress.
* Coordinating with the Technical team to resolve the issues.
* Work actively with the team to assist them in resolving production issues.


**Testing Support:**  

* Collaborating with the Finance team to develop comprehensive test plans and ensure all test scenarios are thoroughly covered.
* Coordinating regression and user acceptance testing (UAT) with the vendor, stakeholders, and IT team. Report results to the Finance leads for approval.
* Proactively informing the Finance stakeholders of any obstacles or delays that may impact deadlines.


So are YOU our next Manager, Finance Systems \& Processes? You are if you…
  
* Hold a University degree in Business or Finance
* Have 6\+ years of progressive experience in a project management role in Finance
* Have experience with process improvement methodologies
* Have a good understanding of banking processes and finance, including practical understanding of financial processes within a banking environment, including general ledger accounting, financial reporting, regulatory compliance and internal controls
* Have experience with project management methodologies, including proficiency in both Agile and Waterfall methodologies
* Have experience in business analysis and requirements gathering, including proven ability to elicit, analyze, document, and validate business requirements from diverse stakeholders
* Have experience in testing and validation, including experience developing and executing comprehensive testing plans, including user acceptance testing (UAT)
* Have the ability to manage concurrent projects / assignments
* Have strong analytical and problem\-solving skills
* Have excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Have a high level of proficiency in project management tools, MS Excel or Google Sheets, Powerpoint or Google Slides


Additional kudos if you…
  
* Hold an Accounting designation (MBA or CPA)
* Have the Project Management Professional (PMP) certification or equivalent
* Have experience using business analysis tools and techniques


**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $110,000 \- $125,000
* The final compensation package will be commensurated with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.

What’s it like working as a Business Systems Analyst at Questrade?
  
  

As a Business Systems Analyst, you will communicate with multiple stakeholders to elicit, define, analyze and document requirements for our cutting\-edge application developments and enhancements to the existing ones. You will be responsible to manage, author and update various BA/BSA artifacts in an Agile environment. You will be leading engineering teams as a Product Owner / Squad Leader on various platform initiatives
  
  

Your mission is to help us spread creative thinking beyond existing industry practices for our exciting new projects, and play a key role in seeing them through to completion.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading...
  
  

* Play the role of a Technical Product Owner, Squad Leader in an agile Scrum/Kanban engineering team
* Prioritize backlog items based on company OKRs and build a roadmap for your platform initiative
* Work with engineering team in Program Increments (PI) and deliver on committed OKRs
* Conduct interviews with subject matter experts (SME), management and end\-users to elicit, define, analyze and document requirements for new products, projects and their enhancements
* Facilitate brainstorming sessions with various stakeholders within the organization
* Conduct walkthroughs of requirements, business logics and workflows of items in varying complexities, with different business and technology stakeholders in various levels to ensure comprehension and feasibility of requirements
* Produce or assist with of a variety of business/systems analysis artifacts including:
* Product backlog / user stories and epics
* Discovery documents / Solution intents
* Use case documents
* Data models; current/future state flow diagrams
* Presentations for requirement/solution walkthroughs
* Utilizing business analysis methodologies and industry practices when solving business problems


So are YOU our next Business Systems Analyst? You are if you have…
  
  

* 3\-5 years experience in product development lifecycle as a BSA / Product Owner
* Experience in the banking/financial/investment systems/solution development area
* Knowledge of writing/understanding/interpreting API documentation
* Knowledge in data analysis using SQL
* CSPO (Certified Scrum Product Owner), CSM (Certified Scrum Master) or other relevant business analysis certification an asset
* Computer science or computer engineering degree is an asset
* Experience in facilitating meetings, documentation, conducting interviews to elicit and write complete and detailed requirements.
* Understanding of business, data, process, and object\-oriented analysis and modeling techniques.
* Strong interpersonal, communication and documentation skills
* Ability to work under pressure and juggling multiple projects with varying deadlines
* Experience working with agile team members (i.e., designer, developer, tester etc.) through design, coding, testing, deployment, maintenance, and support client initiatives phases


**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $80,000 \- $95,000
* The final compensation package will be commensurate with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.

We’re looking for a Head of Sales and Distribution. Could It Be You?
  
The Head of Sales and 3rd Party Distribution is a senior leadership role responsible for the overall strategy, management, and execution of sales and distribution channels for the bank's core product lines, specifically Alternate Single\-Family Home Mortgages, Multi\-Family Home Mortgages, and Deposit Products (e.g., Broker GICs, Term Deposits).
  
This role will drive market share growth, accelerate distribution capabilities, ensure rigorous regulatory compliance, and build a high\-performing sales team focused on achieving ambitious revenue and volume targets while maintaining an exceptional customer experience.
  
Need more details? Keep reading…
  
1\. Sales Strategy \& Business Growth
  
* Develop and execute a comprehensive sales and distribution strategy tailored to the specific product mix (mortgages and deposits) to achieve profitable growth targets.
* Spearhead activity to significantly increase penetration in the single\-family and multi\-family mortgage markets, including developing relationships with key intermediaries and builders.
* Lead the strategic assessment and execution plan for expanding the bank's sales and distribution footprint into new geographic markets.
* Formulate strategies to maximize deposit product acquisition, utilizing GICs and other term deposit offerings to optimize the bank's funding position.
* Monitor market trends, competitive landscapes, and regulatory changes to proactively adjust sales strategies and product positioning.
* Oversee and optimize the customer/ broker onboarding journey for all new mortgage and deposit clients, ensuring a fast, compliant, and positive initial experience that drives long\-term customer loyalty.


2\. Distribution Channel Management
  
* Drive the strategic planning, performance management, and optimization of 3rd party distribution channels, emphasizing the use of data analytics to enhance performance
* Ensure distribution is equipped with the necessary tools, training, and technology to effectively sell and service the defined product suite.
* Lead the sales transformation agenda, focused on customer acquisition and partner servicing across mortgage and deposit products


3\. Product \& Performance Management
  
* Collaborate closely with Product, Operations and Marketing teams on product design, and promotional strategies for all mortgage and brokered deposit products.
* Establish and track key performance indicators (KPIs) for sales performance, channel effectiveness, customer acquisition cost, and profitability across all product lines.
* Provide regular, insightful performance reports and strategic recommendations to the Executive Management team and the Board.


4\. Leadership \& People Development
  
* Lead, mentor, and coach a high\-performing sales and distribution team, fostering a culture of accountability, performance excellence, and customer\-centricity.
* Develop talent management and succession planning programs for key roles within the sales organization.
* Set clear sales goals, implement incentive programs, and conduct regular performance reviews to ensure consistent target achievement.


5\. Risk, Governance, \& Regulatory Expertise
  
* Serve as the primary authority on regulatory compliance within the sales organization.
* Ensure all sales and distribution activities comply with internal policies, legal regulations, and external regulatory requirements pertaining to:
* Mortgage Lending (e.g., consumer protection laws, stress testing, disclosure requirements)
* Deposit\-taking and Consumer Privacy (e.g., AML/KYC, CDIC/FDIC rules, data governance)

We’re looking for our next Business Process Analyst. Could it be you?
  
The Business Process Analyst will play a key role in analyzing, optimizing, and re\-engineering business processes and documentation within financial services organizations.
  
This role requires a strong analytical mindset, excellent communication skills, and a passion for improving efficiency and effectiveness. The ideal candidate will have experience in the financial services industry and a solid understanding of process improvement methodologies.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading...
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
  

**Process Analysis:**  

* Conducting thorough analysis of existing business processes within different departments (e.g., loan origination, customer onboarding, account management).
* Identifying bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and areas for improvement in current processes.
* Documenting processes using flowcharts, diagrams, and other visual aids.
* Gathering data and metrics to measure process performance and identify areas for optimization.


**Process Improvement:**  

* Developing and implementing process improvement initiatives to enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and improve customer satisfaction.
* Utilizing process improvement methodologies such as Lean, Six Sigma, or Agile to drive positive change.
* Collaborating with stakeholders across different departments to gather requirements and ensure buy\-in for process changes and updates to documentation content.
* Assisting in the implementation and integration of new technologies, including providing training and support to end\-users.


**Documentation and Training:**  

* Creating and maintaining comprehensive process documentation, including process maps, procedures, and training materials.
* Creating and maintaining a version control methodology.
* Delivering training to employees on new or updated processes and systems.


**Project Management:**  

* Managing small to medium\-sized process improvement projects, including defining scope, timelines, and resources.
* Tracking project progress, identifying risks, and communicating updates to stakeholders.

We’re looking for our next Manager, Fraud Risk Management. Could It Be You?
  
The Fraud Risk Management Team (2LOD) acts as the independent guardian of the organization’s integrity, accountable for the design, oversight, and governance of the Fraud Risk Framework across Questbank. Our mission is to safeguard the trust of our clients and ensure the firm remains resilient against evolving threats, allowing Canadians to become much more financially successful and secure.
  
Reporting to the Senior Manager, Fraud Risk Management. This role is responsible to support, build and strengthen Questbank’s fraud risk oversight capabilities. This role provides independent oversight, effective challenge, and governance over the business units. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring that fraud risks are identified, measured, monitored, and controlled within the bank’s Risk Appetite. They will work closely with First Line of Defense (1LOD) Fraud Operations, Fraud Strategy, Product, Technology, AML, and Operational Risk to ensure the bank maintains an effective, scalable, and compliant fraud risk framework.
  
The ideal candidate is a fraud expert with strong analytical skills, deep understanding of fraud controls, and proven experience operating within a 3\-Lines\-of\-Defense environment in the Canadian banking industry.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
* Maintaining and updating the Fraud Risk Management Policy, Standards and procedures to ensure alignment with regulatory guidance (OSFI, FCAC, etc.) and industry best practices.
* Assisting in defining and refreshing the Fraud Risk Appetite Statement; ensuring 1LOD business units operate within these defined limits.
* Serving as a subject matter expert (SME) during regulatory exams and internal audits regarding fraud governance.
* Leading the execution of the annual Fraud risk assessments. Aggregating data to identify inherent risks, assess control effectiveness, and determine residual risk across the organization.
* Conducting independent risk assessments on new products, services, or channels (New Product Risk Assessment) to ensure fraud controls are "baked in" prior to launch.
* Reviewing and providing "effective challenge" to the First Line’s Risk and Control Self\-Assessments (RCSAs), ensuring they have accurately rated their fraud risks and controls, including questioning underlying assumptions, validating data accuracy, and ensuring the completeness and sustainability of proposed controls.
* Independently reviewing and challenging 1LOD fraud strategies (i.e, rule logic, model thresholds, authentication flows).
* Designing and executing a risk\-based monitoring program to test the design and operating effectiveness of 1LOD fraud controls (i.e. verifying that KYC checks or high\-value transaction reviews are actually happening).
* Reviewing significant fraud losses or incidents to ensure the First Line has identified the true root cause and implemented sustainable remediation.
* Defining, tracking, and reporting on Key Risk Indicators (KRIs) and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs); overseeing the management of fraud data to enable rapid tracking of trends, detect breaches in risk appetite, and escalate findings to the Risk Committee.
* Committee Reporting: preparing high\-quality risk decks for the Operational Risk Management Committee (ORMC) or Board Risk Committee, summarizing top fraud threats, loss trends, and emerging risks.
* Tracking and validating the closure of fraud\-related issues raised by Internal Audit, Regulators, or self\-identified by the business. Ensuring evidence of closure is sufficient.
* Driving continuous improvement in the Fraud Risk Framework and governance processes to promote effectiveness and efficiency across the bank.
* Maintaining awareness of industry and regulatory developments.
* Leading and participating in vendor due diligence assessments related to fraud.
* Reviewing, editing, and approving comprehensive investigative reports as per internal and regulatory guidelines.
* Advising Senior Management of solutions, fraud issues, control weaknesses or deficiencies and trends identified during reporting/reviews.
* Partnering with internal \& external stakeholders, as well as industry peers on best practices and trends as needed.
* Serving as a point of contact for internal teams for questions related to Fraud Risk.
* Overseeing management of fraud data to enable rapid tracking and monitoring of trends.
* Conducting risk assessments, investigating suspicious internal activities and collaborating with various departments to enhance internal controls.
* Staying abreast of industry standards to ensure appropriate fraud training/education/awareness programs are being delivered to the organization as needed.


So are YOU our next Manager, Fraud Risk Management? You are if you…
  
* Hold a Bachelor’s degree in business, related field or equivalent experience
* Have 6\+ years of experience in Risk Management, specifically within Fraud Risk \& Operational Risk, Fraud Strategy or Internal Audit
* Have strong knowledge of Fraud Risk Management, preferably in the banking industry
* Have a deep understanding of the "Three Lines of Defense" model and the distinction between risk ownership (1LOD) and risk oversight (2LOD)
* Are familiar with relevant regulatory requirements relative to operational risk
* Have hands\-on expertise with fraud controls across customer lifecycle: onboarding/KYC, authentication, digital fraud, payments fraud, credit card fraud, internal fraud, and account takeover
* Understand how to use data analysis tools (i.e. SQL, Python) and visualization platforms (i.e. Tableau, PowerBI) to track fraud trends, challenge control effectiveness, and support KRI/KPI reporting
* Have proven record in working closely with Senior Management across lines of business, influencing and collaboration in cross\-functional teams
* Demonstrate sound analytical thinking, planning, prioritizing, and execution skills
* Have the ability to work effectively with internal and external partners
* Are a proactive self\-starter with a high degree of business and emotional intelligence
* Are a proficient written and verbal communicator
* See the big picture while being comfortable with day to day responsibilities
* Are proficient in Google Suite products (docs, sheets, etc.)
* Have strong presentation/deck building, facilitation skills and strong interpersonal and leadership skills


Additional kudos if you…
  
* Are a Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE) or Certified Financial Crime Specialist (CFCS)

\#LI\-Hybrid

We’re looking for our next Fraud Operations Analyst. Could It Be You?
  
The Fraud Operations Analyst oversees the daily operations and structural components of the Fraud Operations Department, including but not limited to the functions outsourced to third parties service providers as well as Managers, Supervisors, Senior Investigators, Investigators, Fraud Officers, and in prevention, detection, analysis, mitigation, and recovery of fraud for Questbank.
  
Reporting to the Senior Manager, Fraud Operations, the Fraud Operations Analyst will be crucial in supporting the successful execution of the bank's fraud mitigation strategy, ensuring the balance between loss reduction, regulatory compliance, and a positive customer experience. This role focuses on supporting the operational foundation of the Fraud team by assisting in the development and maintenance of key documentation (procedures, playbooks), managing accurate case tracking and reporting, and coordinating efforts with internal partners and external vendors. The Analyst's attention to detail and ability to facilitate organizational readiness are essential to preserving the trust and confidence of all stakeholders in the bank's commitment to proactively securing the enterprise against fraud.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
  

**Analysis and Reporting Support:**  

* Preparing, generating, and maintaining regular reports and dashboards detailing Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Key Risk Indicators (KRIs) related to fraud losses and operational efficiency.
* Assisting in the ongoing monitoring and analysis of fraud data, identifying emerging patterns, trends, and specific fraud schemes impacting the bank's products.
* Ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and consistency of fraud case data within tracking systems to support thorough analysis and management reporting.


**Operational Documentation and Readiness:**  

* Drafting, updating, and organizing critical operational documentation, including fraud procedures, playbooks, process maps, and internal control narratives, ensuring alignment with approved strategies.
* Assisting in the preparation of training and awareness materials for the Fraud team and business partners.
* Gathering and organizing documentation and evidence required for internal audits, compliance reviews, and regulatory submissions related to fraud controls.


**Stakeholder Coordination and Execution:**  

* Scheduling, preparing materials for, and documenting outcomes of working sessions and meetings with internal stakeholders (e.g., IT, Cyber, Operations).
* Coordinating operational inquiries and information exchange with external partners, such as Interac, VISA, and MasterCard, as directed by the Senior Manager.
* Serving as a working team member on fraud management projects, executing assigned tasks related to the implementation of new tools, systems, or process improvements.


So are YOU our next Fraud Operations Analyst? You are if you…
  
* Hold a Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business Administration, Data Analytics, or a related field
* Have 1\-3 years of experience in fraud operations, financial crime investigation, or a highly analytical risk role within the financial services industry
* Have strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively liaise with stakeholders at all levels, both internal and external to the organization
* Are self\-motivated, energetic, results\-oriented and committed to adding value to the organization
* Have a solid understanding of Google Suite and their functionality
* Have strong analytical skills relating to a wide variety of banking and investment products and services, with the ability to interpret complex data and identify patterns and trends
* Have strong understanding of fraud schemes, techniques, and emerging trends across various financial products and services
* Have solid knowledge of the regulatory requirements related to fraud prevention and reporting, such as Anti\-Money Laundering (AML) and Know Your Customer (KYC) regulations
* Are proficient in utilizing fraud detection tools, data analytics, and risk management technologies
* Have exceptional problem\-solving and decision\-making abilities, with a keen attention to detail
* Have strong time management and organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple initiatives to meet deadlines while ensuring high quality of work
* Have strong planning, presentation, project management, and relationship building skills
* Have excellent written communication skills, with the ability to write procedures, scoping documents, and meeting summaries at the appropriate level of detail
* Understand industry Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Key Risk Indicators (KRIs)

We’re looking for our next Senior Auditor, Internal Audit. Could It Be You?
  
  

The Senior Auditor, Internal Audit will support the Senior Manager, Internal Audit in the planning, execution, and reporting of internal audits in accordance with the Annual Internal Audit Plan.
  
  

The role will assist with research, program execution and the drafting of internal audit reports, and as required, assist the Head of Internal Audit in the maintenance of internal audit policies and procedures, systems, and processes.
  
  

The role will contribute to the achievement of Internal Audit’s vision to create, protect, and sustain value by providing the board and management with independent, risk\-based, and objective assurance, advice, insight, and foresight.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
* Assist in the development of audit planning and execution, including identifying risks and related controls for adequacy and effectiveness.
* Lead the execution of assigned internal audits in accordance with the Annual Internal Audit Plan and audit methodologies.
* Prepare high\-quality working papers and detailed test programs, ensuring documentation is complete and timely.
* Ensure audit work adheres to internal audit policies, procedures, systems, and processes, including the Global Internal Audit Standards.
* Ensure that audit programs and test procedures are well documented in the audit management system and sign\-off on completion of working papers within required timelines.
* Draft formal audit reports for presentation to management and contribute input into quarterly reports for the Audit Committee.
* Cultivate and maintain strong, collaborative business relationships with all levels of the organization and external stakeholders.
* Lead assigned ad\-hoc projects and initiatives as directed by the Head of Internal Audit.
* Represent Internal Audit in organizational projects, as required.


So are YOU our next Senior Auditor, Internal Audit? You are if you…
  
* Have a University degree in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, or other related fields.
* Have at least 3\+ years’ audit experience, preferably in financial services and banking, ideally within an OSFI regulated environment.
* Have demonstrable experience auditing credit, market, regulatory compliance, and/or operational risks in a federally regulated financial institution.
* Have strong working knowledge of governance, risk, control frameworks and audit methodologies, including the Global Internal Audit Standards.
* Have strong project management skills demonstrated by ability to complete multiple projects with competing priorities while meeting deadlines.
* Have effective communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Pursue strong professional skepticism while being able to work collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders.

* Have these competencies:
* Professionalism: Pursue strong professional skepticism while being able to work collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders.
* Attitude: Self\-motivated, confident, and capable of working both independently and in a team environment. Bring a positive, can\-do attitude, using creative solutions to solve problems.

The purpose of the Compliance Analyst is to support the Manager, Business Integrity in the supervision of employee and firm conduct including conducting audits, control testing and responding to product orders and document requests from external parties.
  
The Compliance Analyst shall be responsible for assisting in the administering of Questrade’s Compliance and Supervision programs to ensure that the company is in Compliance with Questrade’s policies and procedures, CIRO/CSA Rules and all other laws and securities regulations.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
* Gather documentation and responses to respond to requests for information from various regulators including formal Production Orders from securities authorities and law enforcement.
* Complete detailed reporting and analysis for subsidiaries to report to their Board of Directors on a quarterly basis.
* Monitor and assess compliance by Questrade, staff, and clients
* Conduct due diligence on potential conflicts of interest
* Review employees disclosures related to outside activities, gifts \& entertainment and annual attestations
* Act as a source of knowledge of all the company and regulatory compliance requirements
* Committee administration
* Business unit audits \& testing
* Become familiarized with CIRO, CSA and FCAC rules and all other related laws and regulations
* Develop a clear understanding of compliance standards required by individuals
* Adhere to Questrade’s compliance policies and procedures
* Become proficient in Questrade’s CRM systems
* Work cooperatively with team members and other departments during investigations


So are YOU our next Compliance Analyst, Business Integrity? You are if you…
  
* Are working towards or completed a 4 year post\-secondary degree
* Are proficient in Microsoft Excel and Structured Query Language (SQL) or PowerBI
* Have exceptional verbal and communication skills with the ability to communicate to all audiences in a clear and compelling manner
* Have strong organizational,collaborative and time management skills
* Have knowledge of the mortgage and lending industry, including cost of borrowing disclosure and other regulatory requirements
* Have demonstrated analytical, problem\-solving, and resourcefulness skills


Additional kudos if you…
  
* Have Completed or enrolled in Canadian Securities Course (CSC)

We’re looking for our next Manager, Document Services \& Operations. Could It Be You?
  
Our Shared Services Banking Operations team is dedicated to delivering efficient, standardized, and compliant operational support across banking products. We are committed to operational excellence, mitigating risk, and leveraging technology to improve speed and accuracy.
  
  

We are seeking a detail\-oriented and strategic Manager, Document Services \& Operations. In this critical role within Shared Services, you will serve as the central guardian of banking documentation across both physical and digital mediums.
  
  

You will be responsible for end\-to\-end document governance, oversight of the outsourced physical mailroom logistics and digital document management systems (DMS). Your primary objectives will be to maintain controls through rigorous lifecycle management, protect data security via strict access controls, manage critical vendor performance, and drive efficiency through workflow automation.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
1\. Vendor Oversight \& Mail Operations
  
* Serve as the primary relationship manager for outsourced vendors responsible for physical inbound/outbound mail handling, scanning, and initial digitization logistics.
* Define, monitor, and enforce Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) regarding timeliness, accuracy, and security of mail processing.
* Conduct regular vendor business reviews and audits to ensure compliance with bank security standards and regulatory requirements regarding the handling of Physical Personnel Information (PPI) and sensitive financial documents.
* Troubleshoot operational escalations between the vendor and internal banking departments.


2\. Document Inventory \& Version Control
  
* Establish and maintain a centralized, authoritative inventory of all approved banking form templates, customer\-facing communication templates, and internal Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
* Implement rigorous version management protocols to ensure outdated forms are promptly retired and only current, compliant versions are accessible to staff.
* Collaborate with operation leads, legal and compliance teams to ensure form templates meet current regulatory standards before publishing.


3\. Information Security \& Access Management
  
* Act as the primary administrator for permissions within the organization’s Document Management System (DMS) and related repositories.
* Design, implement, and manage Role\-Based Access Controls (RBAC) to ensure sensitive customer data and bank information is accessible only on a "need\-to\-know" basis, aligning with the principle of least privilege.
* Conduct periodic access reviews and audits to ensure permissions remain appropriate as roles change within the organization.


4\. Document Lifecycle Governance
  
* Oversee the comprehensive lifecycle of banking documents—from initial creation or capture through active use, storage, archival, and final secure destruction.
* Ensure strict adherence to the bank’s Data Retention Schedules and legal hold requirements
* Manage the secure transition of documents from physical formats to legally admissible digital formats.


5\. Workflow Automation \& Process Optimization
  
* Analyze existing document\-heavy operational processes to identify bottlenecks, redundancies, and manual control risks.
* Champion and lead initiatives to optimize these processes using technology, such as Optical Character Recognition (OCR), intelligent document processing, and workflow automation tools.
* Bridge the gap between operational needs and technical solutions, defining business requirements for system enhancements that improve document throughput and accuracy.


So are YOU our next Manager, Document Services \& Operations? You are if you…
  
* Have a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, Information Systems, or related field equivalent experience.
* Have a minimum of 5\-7 years of experience in document management, banking operations, or shared services operations.
* Have a minimum of 2 years in a supervisory or management role.
* Have demonstrated experience managing outsourced vendor relationships, specifically related to mailroom or business process outsourcing (BPO).
* Have proven experience administering enterprise Document Management Systems (e.g., SharePoint, OnBase, FileNet, Documentum).
* Have Regulatory Knowledge: Strong understanding of banking regulations related to record\-keeping and data privacy
* Have Technical Aptitude: Comfort with workflow automation concepts and understanding how data moves between systems.
* Have Process Improvement: Strong analytical skills with a mindset for continuous improvement (Lean Six Sigma certification is a plus).
* Have Risk Management: A high degree of integrity and understanding of operational risk controls in a financial services environment.
* Have Communication: Excellent stakeholder management skills, capable of communicating complex technical and process issues to both vendors and senior internal leadership.


Additional Information…
  
* Please note: This role will be required to be in office 3 days a week


**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $110,000 \- $125,000
* The final compensation package will be commensurated with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.

We’re looking for our next Senior Product Manager, Residential Lending. Could It Be You?
  
The Senior Product Manager acts as the strategic "General Manager" for Questrade’s core secured lending portfolio. In this pivotal leadership role, you will hold accountability for the end\-to\-end product lifecycle of our residential mortgage suite, balancing the dual mandate of optimizing high\-volume portfolios while architecting complex new lending products. Beyond strategy, you will act as a "player\-coach," providing mentorship to agile teams and navigating a complex matrix of stakeholders—including Risk, Legal, and Operations—to ensure lending solutions are compliant, scalable, and operationally sound.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
  

**Strategic Ownership \& Lifecycle Management:**  

* Own the full product lifecycle, from strategy and roadmap definition to delivery and operational readiness.
* Accountable for the P\&L, ensuring products are profitable, compliant, and operationally scalable.
* Define and manage the residential product roadmap, prioritizing features based on market needs, business value, and strategic objectives.


**Agile Leadership \& Orchestration:**  

* Lead and mentor cross\-functional agile development teams, ensuring adherence to agile best practices and managing dependencies to meet the "Definition of Done".
* Collaborate with business stakeholders, engineering, design, risk, and operations to define scope and priorities, bridging commercial goals with technical execution.


**Performance, Risk \& Optimization:**  

* Monitor product performance metrics, funnel conversion, and user adoption, reporting updates to executive stakeholders.
* Identify and mitigate risks, proactively addressing potential roadblocks in the highly regulated mortgage environment.
* Contribute towards the Product Centre of Excellence toolkits to raise the bar for product management practices.


So are YOU our next Senior Product Manager, Residential Lending? You are if you…
  
* Have 7\+ years of experience in product management or product leadership within the financial services industry.
* Have 3\+ years of direct experience delivering solutions specifically within the mortgage or secured lending domain.
* Have proven experience leading Agile teams and implementing Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, SAFe).
* Have a bachelor's degree in business, Finance, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Have experience managing a P\&L and crafting business cases for complex financial products.
* Have demonstrated the ability to lead, motivate, and develop high\-performing agile teams without direct reporting lines.
* Have a strong understanding of software development lifecycles (SDLC) and modern technology stacks relevant to lending (e.g., LOS/LMS, core banking platforms, APIs).
* Proven track record of delivering complex projects on time and within budget.
* Are able to work effectively with stakeholders across different departments (Risk, Legal, Ops, Engineering).
* Have superior verbal and written skills, capable of articulating complex information to technical and non\-technical audiences.


Additional Information…
  
* Please note this role will be required to be in office 3 days a week


**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $135,000 \- $165,000
* The final compensation package will be commensurated with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.

We’re looking for our next Senior Product Manager, Mortgage. Could It Be You?
  
  

The Senior Product Manager will be responsible for managing the product road map for Questrade’s digital mortgage business. The incumbent will be responsible for defining the product roadmap, managing key vendor relationships and ensuring identified product initiatives support both the line of business and enterprise business goals. This will be achieved through superior product design, strategy, influence and leveraging relationships across the business.
  
The Senior Product Manager will play an important role in developing a vision for the prime residential lending product, and crafting a strategy that will utilize both tactical and strategic levers to bring new ideas and efficiency to this business line. Working closely with the Sales and Operations teams, the incumbent will focus on system development and product management on both technology and process efficiency projects that support business growth and brings new technology tools to the DTC channel, increasing operational efficiency and improving client experience.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
  

* Product Management: Executing the product roadmap through ruthless prioritization and leading cross\-functional teams through key projects ensuring sound business practices are adhered to. You will act as an SME to cross\-functional team members across Marketing, Technology, Operations, Training and Legal, Risk and Compliance.
* Product Development Strategies and Roadmap: In conjunction with the business, determine profitability, pricing, product life cycle, distribution channels, positioning, and promotion strategy for prime mortgages. Ideate, design, develop, implement and manage the expansion of the prime mortgage product set and ancillary solutions. Accountable for the continual usage and adoption of products and for providing recommendations on process enhancements and products that enhance our offering.
* Vendor Management: As the product manager, work closely with vendor management to onboard and maintain key vendor relationships that support the prime mortgage business across sales, technology and operations.
* Customer Experience: Represent the needs of our clients and develop/deliver an integrated experience that exceeds their expectations and meets Questrade standards. Collaborate with internal colleagues to develop business requirements/user stories, and client journey roadmaps. Collaborate effectively with complementing product owners to ensure appropriate value add services are woven into the target customer experience.
* Risk Management: Ensure products and on\-going business processes align to internal Policy and Procedure guidelines and deliver a client and team member experience that enables quality business performance.
* Industry Knowledge: Perform on\-going external competitive analysis and market segment analysis. Continually maintain a complete understanding of the Financial Services landscape as it relates to threats and opportunities for existing and future mortgage products.


So are YOU our next Senior Product Manager, Mortgage? You are if you…
  
* Have 3\-5 years’ experience in a product management, or business analysis focused role (or other relevant experience)
* Have Post\-secondary education (preferably in Business or Computer Science)
* Have knowledge of the Mortgage Lending space
* Have strong understanding of Direct to Consumer sales channels
* Have knowledge of and experience in delivering product and program improvements within Agile frameworks
* Are comfortable with creating business cases and presenting them to executive teams
* Have strong project management skills and are able to both lead and execute when the time is needed
* Have experience cultivating strategic partnerships to accelerate growth for the business
* Have an appreciation for connecting with a consumer in the digital age however understand the journey to gradually take customers with you through new digital solutions


Additional Information…
  
* Please note: This role will be required to be in office 3 days a week

We’re looking for our next Senior Manager, Software Engineering. Could It Be You?
  
We are on a mission to democratize finance and empower investors through technology. As part of the Brokerage Technology group, you won’t just be managing code; you will be building the foundational infrastructure that powers our internal efficiency and customer service excellence. We operate at the intersection of high\-stakes finance and cutting\-edge operational tech, delivering best\-in\-class applications that allow our internal teams to serve investors with speed and confidence.
  
We are seeking a strategic and forward\-thinking Senior Manager, Software Engineering to lead a complex technology transformation. In this role, you will move beyond day\-to\-day coding to oversee the engineering members of multiple squads, focusing on high\-impact modernization, cross\-squad dependencies, and the integration of AI/ML capabilities.
  
The ideal candidate is an active thought leader who works closely with Product Management, Operations Leaders, and other key stakeholders to deliver robust, scalable systems. You will articulate the business value of technical debt reduction, drive architectural decisions (specifically Monolith to Microservices), and champion talent development, serving as a bridge between technical strategy and business mission.
  
Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
People \& Culture Leadership
  
* Team Leadership: Strategically lead and manage the engineering team, fostering a culture of technical excellence, accountability, and psychological safety.
* Talent Development: Establish career development frameworks for the department, identifying high\-potential individuals and creating specific growth opportunities, with a focus on upskilling the team in distributed systems and cloud practices.
* Coaching: Act as a hands\-on technical coach to Team Leads and Engineers, championing initiatives to enhance engineering culture and promoting modern engineering practices.
* Vision \& Motivation: Paint an engaging picture of future possibilities for the team, inspiring and motivating engineers through the transition from legacy systems to a modern, AI\-enabled architecture.
* Change Management: Provide steady leadership during complex transitions, proactively managing stakeholder expectations and addressing resistance to ensure alignment across operational departments.


Technical Strategy \& Architecture
  
* Monolith Migration: Lead the multi\-year strategy and execution plan for migrating the monolithic application to a resilient microservices and micro\-frontend architecture.
* Data Strategy: Drive the strategic decoupling and breakdown of centralized databases into domain\-bound databases to improve scalability, reliability, and service autonomy.
* AI/ML Integration: Establish the engineering pipeline (MLOps) and practices necessary to integrate ML/AI agents for process automation, directly contributing to reductions in customer service calls (CSS).
* Strategic Alignment: Ensure technology initiatives align with the broader Tech Strategy and serve as a competitive business edge by improving operational efficiency.
* Architectural Governance: Partner with Directors to make significant cross\-team technical choices, defining high\-level architecture and approving design patterns for broader systems.


Delivery \& Operational Excellence
  
* Product \& Operations Partnership: Act as a key technical voice in the "product trio" (Product, Design, Engineering), ensuring technical feasibility and innovation align with user experience goals and operational SLAs.
* Value Articulation: Articulate the value of technology initiatives (specifically modernization and AI adoption) to stakeholders at all levels, persuasively rallying support and tailoring communication to win buy\-in.
* Lifecycle Management: Lead development initiatives from initial bootstrap and prototyping phases through to production launch, specifically managing the roadmap to balance feature delivery with essential technical debt reduction.
* Reliability \& Performance: Oversee the management and optimization of critical operational applications, ensuring high availability, system Uptime/SLA compliance, and scalability under heavy load.
* Process Optimization: Oversee the development and optimization of department\-wide processes, ensuring they incorporate evolving governance best practices, IT policies, and MLOps principles.


So are YOU our next Senior Manager, Software Engineering? You are if you…
  
Education \& Experience
  
* Minimum 7\+ years of progressive experience in web\-based technologies and Software Engineering.
* Minimum 3\+ years in people management, specifically managing high\-performing teams.
* Degree, diploma, or equivalent directly related work experience in Computer Science or Engineering.
* Proven track record leading major architectural migrations (e.g., Monolith to Microservices) in a high\-volume, production environment is required.
* Experience in enterprise\-grade solutioning and digital financial services is highly preferred.


Technical Proficiency
  
* Extensive experience in Cloud native development of Microservices , specifically using Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) and other Google Cloud Platform components.
* Strong knowledge of front\-end frameworks such as Angular and React Native, with specific expertise in overseeing Micro\-front\-end architecture.
* Familiarity with diverse data storage solutions including Google Cloud SQL, MongoDB, Redis Cache, and SQL Server.
* Understanding of event streaming and messaging architectures using Google Pub/Sub and Kafka.
* Proficiency with modern CI/CD pipelines and collaboration tools such as Gitlab, Jira, and Confluence.
* Understanding of MLOps principles and experience establishing engineering pipelines for AI/ML integration.
* Strong skills in application performance tuning and optimization.


Leadership \& Strategic Capabilities
  
* Advanced ability to identify potential stakeholders, analyze expectations, and work independently to manage relationships across the organization.
* Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to remain calm under pressure and coach teams through change and ambiguity.
* Expertise in the full software development life cycle (SDLC), including design, configuration, integration, testing, quality assurance, and post\-production support.
* Strong skills in risk mitigation and ensuring the scalability and maintainability of complex systems.
* Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, capable of translating technical concepts for business audiences.


**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $ 156,000 \- $195,000
* The final compensation package will be commensurate with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.
