What’s it like working as a Software Engineering Expert at Questrade?
  
As a Software Engineering Expert specializing in Crypto and Alternative Trading Products at Questrade, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our digital asset and alternative offerings. You'll be instrumental in building both the user interfaces and core infrastructure for our retail crypto trading platforms and internal administrative tools, expanding our crypto capabilities across all Questrade products, and launching new alternative trading products within our Growth Portfolio entity.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading...
  
  

* Platform Development: Architect, design, develop, and maintain robust, scalable, and secure full\-stack applications for Questrade's retail crypto and alternatives trading platforms, leveraging modern architectural patterns, microfrontend approaches, and best\-in\-class technologies.
* Infrastructure Expansion: Drive the expansion of crypto infrastructure across various Questrade products, ensuring seamless integration, high performance, and future scalability.
* New Product Launches: Lead the development and launch of new crypto capabilities for clients and internal teams, from ideation to deployment, with an emphasis on speed\-to\-market and quality.
* Growth Portfolio Innovation: Contribute to the architecture, build, and delivery of other new alternative trading products within the dedicated Growth Portfolio entity, actively identifying and adopting emerging technologies.
* API Design \& Integration: Create, document, and integrate with clear, efficient, and secure APIs (including RESTful and WebSocket APIs) to facilitate all aspects of crypto and alternatives transactions, setting standards for integration and developer experience.
* Team Leadership \& Mentorship: Coach and mentor junior and intermediate team members, fostering a culture of continuous improvement, knowledge sharing, and adoption of innovative development practices within the software development team.
* Operational Support: Provide expert support for all crypto trading and transfer solutions, ensuring system stability and reliability through proactive monitoring and incident resolution.
* Efficiency \& Automation: Identify opportunities to automate workflows, optimize system performance, and enhance development pipelines to boost team efficiency and accelerate delivery cycles.
* Problem Solving: Diagnose and troubleshoot complex technical issues, ensuring high availability and optimal performance of crypto and trading systems.
* Collaboration: Work closely with product owners, developers, QA engineers, and other stakeholders to translate business requirements into cutting\-edge technical solutions.
* Research \& Innovation: Stay abreast of the latest trends and technologies in the blockchain and cryptocurrency space, actively bringing innovative solutions and new tools to the team to maintain our competitive edge
* Experience in the financial services or FinTech industry.
* Experience launching new products from 0 to 1\.
* Familiarity with security best practices in blockchain and financial applications.
* Experience integrating common crypto platform vendors (hot wallets, custodians, execution management service, payment processors) is a plus.


So are YOU our next Software Engineering Expert? You are if you have…
  
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 8\+ years of experience in software development, with a strong focus on building scalable and resilient systems and user interfaces.
* Proficiency in modern frontend frameworks (e.g., Angular, React, VUE, React Native).
* Proficiency in one or more modern backend programming languages (e.g., C\#, Java, Go, Python, Node.js), with a preference for Java and Spring Boot.
* Experience designing and building highly interactive and responsive web and mobile applications.
* Experience designing and building RESTful and WebSocket APIs.
* Solid understanding of object\-oriented programming (OOP) and SOLID principles.
* Experience with relational and/or NoSQL databases, and optimizing applications for large datasets.
* Experience with event\-driven architecture and message queues (e.g., PubSub, Kafka, RabbitMQ).
* Experience with state management libraries and patterns.
* Experience with unit and integration testing frameworks and practices (e.g., Jest, Mira, Cypress).
* Experience with micro frontend architectures is desired.
* Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, Azure, AWS) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) is a plus.
* System Design: Proven ability to design and architect complex, high\-availability systems with a focus on performance, security, and maintainability
* Problem\-Solving Skills: Exceptional analytical and problem\-solving abilities, with a keen eye for detail and a proactive approach to issue resolution.
* Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts clearly to both technical and non\-technical audiences.
* Collaboration: A strong team player who thrives in a collaborative environment and is eager to share knowledge and expertise, fostering a culture of continuous learning.
* Initiative: A self\-starter with a proactive mindset and a relentless drive to deliver high\-quality solutions and push technological boundaries.


**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $130,000 \- $195,000
* The final compensation package will be commensurate with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.

We’re looking for our next Manager, Software Engineering. Could It Be You?
  
We are on a mission to democratize finance and empower investors through technology. As part of the Brokerage Technology group, you won’t just be managing code; you will be building the financial future for our customers. We operate at the intersection of high\-stakes finance and cutting\-edge user experience, delivering best\-in\-class applications that allow everyday investors to trade, track, and grow their wealth with confidence.
  
We are seeking a strategic and forward\-thinking Manager, Software Engineering to lead a complex technology portfolio. In this role, you will move work on day\-to\-day coding and oversee the engineering members of one or more squads, focusing on dependency management, short and long\-term architectural goals, and the maturation of our engineering culture.
  
The ideal candidate is an active thought leader who works closely with Product Management, Designers, and other key stakeholders to deliver best\-in\-class applications. You will articulate the business value of technology, drive architectural decisions in partnership with Senior Leaders, and champion talent development within the department, serving as a bridge between technical strategy and business mission.
  
Need more details? Keep reading…
  
People \& Culture Leadership
  
* Strategically lead and manage engineering members across one or multiple squads, overseeing cross\-squad dependencies and ensuring alignment with long\-term organizational goals.
* Establish career development for your direct reports, identifying high\-potential individuals and creating specific growth opportunities.
* Champion initiatives to enhance engineering culture, promoting diversity, inclusion, and a sense of belonging while working with People \& Culture to address systemic issues.
* Paint an engaging picture of future possibilities for the team, inspiring and motivating engineers through compelling presentations that outline the department's technical vision.
* Provide steady leadership during transitions or complex situations, keeping teams focused and moving forward despite incomplete information.


Technical Strategy \& Architecture
  
* Manage a complex tech portfolio, helping to set the direction for overall systems and aligning the technology roadmap with specific business missions.
* Define high\-level architecture and approve design patterns for broader systems, leading significant technical investments and vendor selection.
* Collaborate with technical leaders on setting technical direction partnered with direct coding and troubleshooting.


Delivery \& Operational Excellence
  
* Act as a key technical voice in the "product trio" (Product, Design, Engineering), ensuring technical feasibility and innovation align with user experience goals.
* Articulate the value of technology initiatives to stakeholders at all levels, persuasively rallying support and tailoring communication to win buy\-in.
* Lead development initiatives from initial bootstrap and prototyping phases through to production launch and ongoing maintenance.
* Oversee the management and optimization of applications serving a large number of customers, ensuring high availability, performance, and scalability under heavy load.


So are YOU our next Manager, Software Engineering? You are if you…
  
Education \& Experience
  
* Minimum 5\+ years of experience in back end technologies with 3\+ years in people management
* Degree, diploma, or equivalent directly related work experience in Computer Science or Engineering.
* Digital financial services experience is highly preferred.
* Experience in enterprise\-grade solutioning is highly desirable.


Technical Proficiency
  
* Extensive knowledge in c\+\+ development with experience with highly scalable low latency systems
* Some experience in Cloud native development of Microservices , specifically using Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) and other Google Cloud Platform components.
* Familiarity with diverse data storage solutions including Google Cloud SQL, MongoDB, Redis Cache, and SQL Server.
* Understanding of event streaming and messaging architectures such as Google Pub/Sub,Kafka etc.
* Proficiency with modern CI/CD pipelines and collaboration tools such as Gitlab, Jira, and Confluence.
* Strong skills in application performance tuning and optimization.


Leadership \& Strategic Capabilities
  
* Advanced ability to identify potential stakeholders, analyze expectations, and work independently to manage relationships across the organization.
* Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to remain calm under pressure and coach teams through change and ambiguity.
* Expertise in the full software development life cycle (SDLC), including design, configuration, integration, testing, quality assurance, and post\-production support.
* Strong skills in risk mitigation and ensuring the scalability and maintainability of complex systems.
* Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, capable of translating technical concepts for business audiences

* Base salary range: $132,000 \- $165,000

We’re looking for our next Director of Total Rewards \& People Operations. Could It Be You?
  
As the Director, Total Rewards \& People Operations, you will be a strategic leader, reporting to the Chief People Officer. You will be responsible for developing a strategically aligned and appropriately competitive global Total Rewards strategy and leading a highly effective, customer\-centric People Operations team. You will drive our compensation philosophy, manage Total Rewards, and lead the adoption of advanced technology and people analytics to enable data\-driven decisions across Questrade Financial Group (QFG).
  
  

This is a critical role for a proven change agent who can lead, motivate, and develop a high\-performing team while operating in a growing and evolving environment.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
Total Rewards \& Compensation Strategy
  
* Develop and lead the implementation of QFG’s global Total Rewards strategy, including defining our compensation philosophy and identifying ways to differentiate QFG as an employer of choice.
* Monitor external trends, practices, and innovations to ensure QFG’s competitiveness across all countries we operate in.
* Determine optimal sources and frequency of survey data and lead analysis to ensure positioning is aligned with QFG’s compensation strategy/philosophy.
* Oversee the flawless execution of annual compensation cycles, from budget recommendation to processing and communication.
* Manage all global health and retirement plans and oversee annual benefit plan renewals.
* Design and oversee implementation of Recognition and Reward strategies that actively reinforce QFG’s culture.
* In partnership with the Head of P\&C for Questbank, preparation of materials and reports as required for the Human Resource and Compensation Board Committee.
* Assessment of Total Rewards related vendors, ensuring ongoing effectiveness and engagement with the right partners at the right time delivering the right level of service at appropriate cost
* Ensure Total Rewards are effectively communicated to appropriate positioned for attraction and retention
* Ensure QFG remains compliant with all relevant global total rewards, pay equity, and pay transparency legislation and stay abreast of emerging trends in the regulatory environment. Develop strategies to optimize employee and manager experience alongside compliance.


People Operations \& Service Delivery
  
* Ensure the People Operations team is structured and uses maximized technology to deliver highly customer\-centric, responsive, and efficient services.
* Oversee critical operations, including background checks, onboarding, employee enquiries, Leave of Absence management, and immigration matters, ensuring adherence to defined service level expectations.
* Provide support and leadership for the annual budget process.
* Ensure P\&C related core policies are adequate, consistent, and reviewed and updated on an appropriate cadence.


HR Technology, People Analytics, and Job Architecture
  
* Lead the advancement of technology utilization, particularly with our current HRIS (Ceridian Dayforce), actively seeking opportunities to use AI to increase efficiency.
* Develop and implement a plan to enhance people analytics capabilities, enabling far greater data\-driven decision\-making and KPI reporting.
* Maintain and if necessary enhance QFG’s job architecture, partnering with HR Leaders and stakeholders to address unique cases and respond to changes in organizational strategy.
* Actively seek opportunities to use AI to increase efficiency and effectiveness across the whole portfolio


Leadership \& Strategic Partnership
  
* Provide leadership, coaching, and direction to a team of Total Rewards and People Operations professionals.
* Function as a strategic partner and subject matter expert within the People \& Culture (P\&C) leadership team, contributing to overarching P\&C strategies, while embracing the “one team” philosophy.


So are YOU our next Director of Total Rewards \& People Operations? You are if you…
  
* Have 10\+ years of HR experience, with the majority in Total Rewards, and proven experience operating in a global environment.
* Have 3\+ years of people and strategic leadership experience, with a proven track record of leading, motivating, and developing high\-performing teams.
* Have a University degree with an HR related designation/qualification/certification preferred.
* Have strong interpersonal and communication skills; able to build credibility and influence stakeholders up to the Executive level.
* Have strong systems and process leadership orientation, with a change agent mindset who can adapt with agility and lead others through transformation.
* Have excellent problem\-solving, analytical skills, and strong business acumen.
* Are a highly customer\-centric mindset with a strong sense of urgency.
* Are a Change agent and can adapt with agility to a rapidly growing and evolving environment and effectively lead others through change and transformation.

We’re looking for our next Director of Total Rewards \& People Operations. Could It Be You?
  
As the Director, Total Rewards \& People Operations, you will be a strategic leader, reporting to the Chief People Officer. You will be responsible for developing a strategically aligned and appropriately competitive global Total Rewards strategy and leading a highly effective, customer\-centric People Operations team. You will drive our compensation philosophy, manage Total Rewards, and lead the adoption of advanced technology and people analytics to enable data\-driven decisions across Questrade Financial Group (QFG).
  
  

This is a critical role for a proven change agent who can lead, motivate, and develop a high\-performing team while operating in a growing and evolving environment.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
Total Rewards \& Compensation Strategy
  
* Develop and lead the implementation of QFG’s global Total Rewards strategy, including defining our compensation philosophy and identifying ways to differentiate QFG as an employer of choice.
* Monitor external trends, practices, and innovations to ensure QFG’s competitiveness across all countries we operate in.
* Determine optimal sources and frequency of survey data and lead analysis to ensure positioning is aligned with QFG’s compensation strategy/philosophy.
* Oversee the flawless execution of annual compensation cycles, from budget recommendation to processing and communication.
* Manage all global health and retirement plans and oversee annual benefit plan renewals.
* Design and oversee implementation of Recognition and Reward strategies that actively reinforce QFG’s culture.
* In partnership with the Head of P\&C for Questbank, preparation of materials and reports as required for the Human Resource and Compensation Board Committee.
* Assessment of Total Rewards related vendors, ensuring ongoing effectiveness and engagement with the right partners at the right time delivering the right level of service at appropriate cost
* Ensure Total Rewards are effectively communicated to appropriate positioned for attraction and retention
* Ensure QFG remains compliant with all relevant global total rewards, pay equity, and pay transparency legislation and stay abreast of emerging trends in the regulatory environment. Develop strategies to optimize employee and manager experience alongside compliance.


People Operations \& Service Delivery
  
* Ensure the People Operations team is structured and uses maximized technology to deliver highly customer\-centric, responsive, and efficient services.
* Oversee critical operations, including background checks, onboarding, employee enquiries, Leave of Absence management, and immigration matters, ensuring adherence to defined service level expectations.
* Provide support and leadership for the annual budget process.
* Ensure P\&C related core policies are adequate, consistent, and reviewed and updated on an appropriate cadence.


HR Technology, People Analytics, and Job Architecture
  
* Lead the advancement of technology utilization, particularly with our current HRIS (Ceridian Dayforce), actively seeking opportunities to use AI to increase efficiency.
* Develop and implement a plan to enhance people analytics capabilities, enabling far greater data\-driven decision\-making and KPI reporting.
* Maintain and if necessary enhance QFG’s job architecture, partnering with HR Leaders and stakeholders to address unique cases and respond to changes in organizational strategy.
* Actively seek opportunities to use AI to increase efficiency and effectiveness across the whole portfolio


Leadership \& Strategic Partnership
  
* Provide leadership, coaching, and direction to a team of Total Rewards and People Operations professionals.
* Function as a strategic partner and subject matter expert within the People \& Culture (P\&C) leadership team, contributing to overarching P\&C strategies, while embracing the “one team” philosophy.


So are YOU our next Director of Total Rewards \& People Operations? You are if you…
  
* Have 10\+ years of HR experience, with the majority in Total Rewards, and proven experience operating in a global environment.
* Have 3\+ years of people and strategic leadership experience, with a proven track record of leading, motivating, and developing high\-performing teams.
* Have a University degree with an HR related designation/qualification/certification preferred.
* Have strong interpersonal and communication skills; able to build credibility and influence stakeholders up to the Executive level.
* Have strong systems and process leadership orientation, with a change agent mindset who can adapt with agility and lead others through transformation.
* Have excellent problem\-solving, analytical skills, and strong business acumen.
* Are a highly customer\-centric mindset with a strong sense of urgency.
* Are a Change agent and can adapt with agility to a rapidly growing and evolving environment and effectively lead others through change and transformation.

We’re looking for our next Privacy Program Manager. Could It Be You?
  
The Privacy Program Manager is a core operational role responsible for the daily execution of the enterprise Privacy Program.
  
  

Reporting to the Chief Privacy Officer, this role owns critical operational functions including incident management, regulatory response, and the end\-to\-end Privacy Impact Assessment process for using a Privacy by Design approach. Key deliverables include: ensuring overall compliance with Canadian privacy laws, driving program efficiency, and drafting formal executive\-level and board reporting. This role is expected to act as an automation driver, actively seeking out and implementing AI and other emerging technologies to streamline core privacy practices, improve overall efficiency, and free up resources for high\-value strategic work.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
Regulatory Compliance
  
* Front\-Line Management: Oversee and actively manage customer\-facing privacy communication channels, including privacy inboxes for multiple affiliates
* Regulatory Response: Lead the investigative process for formal privacy complaints, including gathering necessary data and drafting formal responses to customers and regulators.
* Data Subject Rights (DSRs): Manage the end\-to\-end process for handling all customer\-related requests, including Data Subject Access Requests (DSARs).


Executive Reporting
  
* Strategic Reporting: Draft quarterly Board reports and executive summaries, detailing key privacy metrics, program status, emerging risks, and activities for review by senior leadership.
* Risk Acceptance: Facilitate the formal risk acceptance process by drafting risk acceptance documentation for review and acceptance by senior leadership.


Incident Management
  
* Incident Leadership: Lead and manage internal privacy incidents from initial detection through resolution, including conducting Real Risk of Significant Harm (RROSH) assessments to determine regulatory reporting obligations.
* External Notification: Draft formal regulator and impacted client notices following a privacy incident, as required.


Vendor Management
  
* Third\-Party Due Diligence: Review vendor responses to Third\-Party Access Questionnaires to assess privacy risks and recommend mitigation strategies.


Program Governance
  
* Policy Documentation: Draft, update, and maintain essential internal privacy policies, standards, and guidelines.
* CASL Compliance: Provide guidance to Marketing teams regarding compliance with Canada’s Anti\-Spam Legislation (CASL), including reviewing and approving Commercial Electronic Messages (CEMs).


Risk Assessment
  
* Privacy Impact Assessments (PIAs): Lead and execute end\-to\-end PIAs for all project sizes, including high\-risk and complex initiatives.
* Privacy by Design (PbD): Ensure the application of PbD principles by reviewing front\-end UX/UI documentation for privacy compliance before implementation.
* Business Advisory: Provide timely, ad\-hoc general privacy guidance and support across all business units and dedicated guidance for key projects.


Training, Awareness, and Automation
  
* Training Development: Design, develop, and implement comprehensive privacy training modules, including annual training, customer\-facing training, human error incident training, and department\-specific sessions.
* Education: Manage and coordinate internal and client\-facing privacy awareness initiatives.
* Automation Initiatives: Drive process automation within the Privacy Office, using AI to streamline core privacy functions (e.g., PIAs, DSARs, intake).


So are YOU our next Privacy Program Manager? You are if you have…
  
* Experience: Minimum of 3 years of experience in data privacy, compliance, or a related field (e.g., legal, information security).
* Education: A bachelor's degree in Law, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related discipline is generally expected.
* Certifications: Professional certification from the International Association of Privacy Professionals (IAPP) is highly desirable, preferably Certified Information Privacy Manager (CIPM) and/or Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP/C).
* Regulatory Knowledge: Working knowledge of Canadian privacy legislation (e.g., PIPEDA, CASL, and provincial equivalents) is required. Knowledge of international regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) is an asset.
* Technical Proficiency: Proven experience working with Privacy Management software to manage PIAs, DSARs, and incident response.
* Strategic Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a proven ability to synthesize and communicate complex technical privacy concepts clearly to diverse audiences, including executive leadership, technical teams, and customer\-facing staff.
* Problem\-Solving \& Leadership: Demonstrated ability to lead and manage complex privacy matters (e.g., PIAs, incident response) from initiation through completion.
* Process Improvement: A proactive approach to driving operational efficiency and automation within the Privacy Program (e.g., implementing AI tools where appropriate, streamlining intake forms, improving PIA flow).
* Advisory Skills: Ability to provide timely, accurate, and practical ad\-hoc privacy advice and guidance to various business units across the organization.
* Attention to Detail: Meticulous approach to reviewing contract documentation (e.g., DPAs), regulatory responses, and front\-end user experience (UX) documentation for privacy adequacy.


Additional Information…
  
* Please note: This role will be required to be in office 3 days a week


**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $100,000 \- $110,000
* The final compensation package will be commensurated with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.

We’re looking for an Executive Business Partner. Could It Be You?
  
The Executive Business Partner will provide comprehensive, high\-level administrative, organizational, and personal support to the President of Canada’s most dynamic financial institution. This is a critical, 24/7 support position requiring exceptional judgment, discretion, flexibility, a proactive approach, a strong sense of ownership to anticipate the President's needs and driving solutions autonomously. The successful candidate will act as the primary gatekeeper and organizational force, ensuring the President's professional and personal lives run seamlessly and efficiently.
  
Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
1\. Executive, Administrative, and Business Support
  
* Business Acumen \& Relationship Management: Quickly assimilate a deep understanding of Questrade Financial Groups (QFG) operational structure, strategic goals, and current initiatives. Build, nurture and maintain high\-level business relationships and comprehensive knowledge of key external stakeholders (incl. major clients, board members, regulatory contacts and corporate partners) and internally across complex multi\-line business and global organizational structures ensuring seamless communication and effective stakeholder engagement.
* Communication Prioritization: Leverage business knowledge to effectively screen, prioritize, and triage communications, ensuring the President is focused on the most critical strategic and client\-facing issues.
* Meeting Preparation: Prepare agendas, collect necessary briefing materials, handle A/V requirements, and take meticulous minutes for executive and board\-level meetings. Ensure the President is fully briefed on the background, relationship history, and objectives related to meeting attendees (clients, regulators, etc.).
* Calendar Management: Proactively manage and optimize an extremely complex and demanding schedule, including business meetings, board appearances, high\-profile industry events, and personal appointments. Anticipate conflicts and logistical issues.
* Travel Coordination: Handle all aspects of domestic and international travel, including booking flights (private and commercial), accommodations, ground transportation, detailed itinerary preparation, and managing travel logistics across multiple time zones.
* Expense Management: Process and track all expense reports, invoices, and departmental budgets with precision and confidentiality.


2\. Personal and Logistical Support
  
* Personal Schedule: Serve as the primary point of contact for the President's personal travel and calendar scheduling. Manage all aspects of the President's personal calendar, including family engagements, doctor's appointments, reservations, and social events.
* Event Planning: Coordinate and execute professional events, ranging from small private dinners to large corporate gatherings.
* Errands and Procurement: Handle personal ad\-hoc requests.


3\. Operational and On\-Call Support
  
* 24/7 Availability: Must be accessible and available to respond to urgent matters, travel changes, and executive support needs outside of traditional business hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays.
* Crisis Management: Quickly respond to and resolve last\-minute changes or emergencies (e.g., severe weather, travel disruptions, security concerns), demonstrating calm under pressure.
* Document Security: Maintain and organize a highly confidential physical and digital filing system, ensuring the integrity and security of all sensitive documents, financial records, and proprietary information.


So are YOU our next Executive Business Partner? You are if you…
  
* Have a minimum of 8\-10 years of experience supporting a C\-level executive (CEO, President, or Managing Director) in a fast\-paced, high\-stakes environment, preferably within the finance, technology, banking, or corporate services sectors.
* Have demonstrated ability to understand complex business terminology, organizational charts, and strategic priorities. Prior experience supporting executives who regularly interact with major clients and institutional investors is highly preferred.
* Have the proven ability to build, nurture, and maintain high\-level, confidential business relationships externally and internally across complex, global, multi\-national or multi\-office organizational structures, ensuring seamless communication and effective stakeholder engagement
* Have demonstrated exceptional initiative, a proactive approach, and a strong sense of ownership to anticipate the President's needs, streamline operations, and drive solutions autonomously, ensuring the professional and personal lives run seamlessly and efficiently.
* Have the proven ability to handle highly sensitive, confidential, and proprietary information with uncompromising integrity and professionalism.
* Have expert\-level skills in Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google workspace and experience with modern travel and expense management software.
* Have exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to interact confidently and professionally with board members, high\-net\-worth individuals, and international stakeholders.
* Have the demonstrated ability to manage complex, multi\-leg international travel, including understanding visa requirements and cultural norms.

We’re looking for our next Director, Credit Risk Strategy. Could It Be You?
  
The Director, Credit Risk Strategy will lead a team that leverages data and analytics to define and execute credit strategies for the full customer lifecycle. This leader will also serve as the Single Point of Contact (SPOC) from Risk to define, build, and manage a state\-of\-the\-art risk strategy and implement them in the system for Questbank.
  
This role is responsible for both defining the strategic vision for risk systems and developing the credit strategies (e.g., adjudication, account management) that run on them. The ultimate goal is to enable profitable growth and deliver a best\-in\-class customer experience by ensuring that the portfolio remains profitable while operating within the risk appetite.
  
This position partners closely with enterprise partners in Product, Technology, Finance, Operations, and Sales to lead strategic projects.
  
Reporting to the Chief Credit Risk Officer, the Director, Credit Risk Strategy is responsible for heading the end\-to\-end development, implementation, and maintenance of the enterprise's credit risk strategies , as well as the data infrastructure and technology systems that support them.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
  

**Strategy \& Analytics:**  

* Developing and implementing life\-time value (LTV) based credit adjudication strategies.
* Developing and implementing LTV\-driven account management strategies (e.g., limit increases/decreases).
* Working with the modeling team to develop and maintain credit risk and predictive models.
* Developing and implementing foundational testing for optimizing initial limit assignment and pricing.
* Monitoring, tracking, and reporting on credit strategy performance, incorporating industry benchmarks.
* Monitoring, identifying, and escalating material credit risks, taking ownership of action plans.


**Systems, Data \& Infrastructure:**  

* Defining the strategic roadmap and system requirements for end\-to\-end risk management (adjudication, authorization, collections, fraud).
* Leading the deployment of risk infrastructure for new product launches.
* Defining and designing the Risk Data strategy for both production use and offline analytics, working with Technology to execute.
* Setting standards and processes for data governance, accuracy, and completeness.
* Ensuring appropriate controls for change management within the decision\-engine.


**Leadership \& Project Management:**  

* Leading a best\-in\-class credit risk management team, creating a culture of empowerment and continuous development.
* Leading and managing large\-scale, complex initiatives and projects with long timelines and multiple stakeholders.
* Defining achievable milestones and providing regular updates to senior executives on progress and challenges.
* Developing in\-house expertise to manage onboarded systems for self\-reliance and cost reduction.


**Vendor \& Stakeholder Management:**  

* Serving as the primary SPOC from Risk for cross\-functional teams (e.g., Journey, Products, Marketing, Technology, Compliance).
* Managing key vendor relationships, including credit bureaus and decision\-engine/platform providers (e.g., Tsys, HPS).
* Managing vendor contracts with strong discipline on costs, optimizing orchestration without compromising risk mitigation.
* Supporting Legal and Compliance to deliver AML and regulatory reporting requirements.


So are YOU our next Director, Credit Risk Strategy? You are if you…
  
* Hold a University Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Business, or Engineering)
* Have a combined 10\+ years of experience in financial services/fintech, developing credit strategies and implementing credit strategy
* Have 7\+ years of experience in a leadership and people management capacity
* Have experience with Tsys or HPS
* Have experience with adjudication and transaction modeling system
* Have experience with Fraud related systems
* Have experience with managing credit adjudication system
* Have a proven track record of analyzing credit card data and making strategic recommendations to senior management
* Possess strong statistical knowledge and experience with credit strategy development for credit cards.
* Have a deep understanding of the consumer credit card industry, P\&L reporting, and the credit card lifecycle
* Have demonstrated an ability to lead complex, long\-term projects
* Are proactive, agile with a start\-up mindset to move quickly
* Are team oriented and persuasive with a collaborative mindset
* Have strong communication skills, with the ability to present information in a succinct and organized manner
* See the "big picture" while remaining comfortable with day\-to\-day responsibilities

**Leadership \& Project Management:**  

* Leading a best\-in\-class credit risk management team, creating a culture of empowerment and continuous development.
* Leading and managing large\-scale, complex initiatives and projects with long timelines and multiple stakeholders.
* Defining achievable milestones and providing regular updates to senior executives on progress and challenges.
* Developing in\-house expertise to manage onboarded systems for self\-reliance and cost reduction.


**Vendor \& Stakeholder Management:**  

* Serving as the primary SPOC from Risk for cross\-functional teams (e.g., Journey, Products, Marketing, Technology, Compliance).
* Managing key vendor relationships, including credit bureaus and decision\-engine/platform providers (e.g., Tsys, HPS).
* Managing vendor contracts with strong discipline on costs, optimizing orchestration without compromising risk mitigation.
* Supporting Legal and Compliance to deliver AML and regulatory reporting requirements.


So are YOU our next Director, Credit Risk Strategy? You are if you…
  
* Hold a University Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Business, or Engineering)
* Have a combined 10\+ years of experience in financial services/fintech, developing credit strategies and implementing credit strategy
* Have 7\+ years of experience in a leadership and people management capacity
* Have experience with Tsys or HPS
* Have experience with adjudication and transaction modeling system
* Have experience with Fraud related systems
* Have experience with managing credit adjudication system
* Have a proven track record of analyzing credit card data and making strategic recommendations to senior management
* Possess strong statistical knowledge and experience with credit strategy development for credit cards.
* Have a deep understanding of the consumer credit card industry, P\&L reporting, and the credit card lifecycle
* Have demonstrated an ability to lead complex, long\-term projects
* Are proactive, agile with a start\-up mindset to move quickly
* Are team oriented and persuasive with a collaborative mindset
* Have strong communication skills, with the ability to present information in a succinct and organized manner
* See the "big picture" while remaining comfortable with day\-to\-day responsibilities

We’re looking for our next Analyst, Procurement \& Vendor Management. Could It Be You?
  
The Analyst, Procurement \& Vendor Management, plays a critical role in the execution of the organization’s Procurement and Vendor Management activities across the entire vendor lifecycle. This position is responsible for both (i) executing procurement processes including purchasing new goods and services, onboarding vendors, and managing renewals; as well as (ii) managing vendor data, facilitating due diligence, reporting, coordinating vendor reviews, and ensuring compliance with vendor management policies. The Analyst will work closely with the Manager, Vendor Management, the entire Procurement \& Vendor Management team, and internal stakeholders to drive efficiency and transparency across the vendor lifecycle
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
* Execute each stage of the vendor lifecycle including purchasing and sourcing of goods and services, vendor discovery and demo processes, agreement management, commercial negotiation, renewal, offboarding, and mid\-term changes.
* Support business teams in conducting RFPs, RFIs, and other vendor sourcing activities including proofs of concept and trials.
* Facilitate the vendor tiering assessment process with requesters.
* Facilitate the vendor due diligence process and engage subject matter experts to review and opine on responses to due diligence questionnaires.
* Perform initial contract review and redlining in accordance with internally published contract negotiation playbook.
* Support lines of business and contract owners in vendor performance tracking and monitoring.
* Maintain accurate vendor and contract records enabling a robust contract compliance program, including key date tracking, obligation tracking, SLA monitoring, etc.
* Assist the lines of business in preparing for and conducting annual, quarterly or other business review meetings and processes with vendors.
* Act as key contact and liaison for lines of business and contract owners in the event of a performance breach or other matters requiring escalation with vendors.
* Engage with lines of business and contract owners for regular strategy updates.
* Monitor industry and vendor trends.
* Play a key role in the implementation of new technologies or enhancement of existing technologies for contract lifecycle management, contract compliance, due diligence, obligations and risk tracking as they relate to vendor matters, and strategic improvements of our vendor ecosystem, and constantly iterate and improve on these workflows to achieve efficiencies at scale.
* Contribute to the integration of AI\-enabled processes for contract review, negotiation, and data extraction
* Leadership: Ability to effectively lead interactions with lines of business, contract owners and vendors.
* Strategic Thinking: Capacity to plan and execute long\- and short\-term vendor strategies that align with business goals.
* Collaboration: Robust skills in working with internal and external partners to achieve shared objectives.
* Adaptability: Openness to adopting and implementing new technologies and processes.
* Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills for negotiating and stakeholder engagement.
* Professionalism: Presents themselves in a professional manner in all scenarios, whether dealing with internal or external partners.
* Problem Solving: Ability to identify and resolve issues related to vendor performance and risk. Can think in a non\-linear way to find strategic solutions to problems as they arise.


So are YOU our next Vendor \& Procurement Management? You are if you…
  
  

* Minimum of 1\-3 years of proven experience in a procurement or vendor management role, facilitating due diligence, ongoing monitoring, and lifecycle management in a fast\-paced environment.
* Demonstrated success in navigating a changing stakeholder landscape and delivering forward\-looking Vendor Management to meet stakeholder needs.
* Experience using third party risk management software, such as OneTrust, to conduct due diligence assessments and other activities.
* Strong understanding of vendor risk, compliance, and performance metrics, with specialized knowledge of financial services compliance and risk factors as an asset.
* Proficiency in implementing vendor lifecycle technologies and processes.
* Strong knowledge and ability in both Microsoft Office Suite and Google Workspace.
* Strong interest in AI as an enabling tool in the workplace and personal life


Additional Information…
  
* Please note: This role will be required to be in office 3 days a week


**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $65,000 \- $75,000
* The final compensation package will be commensurate with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.


Sounds like you? Click below to apply!
  
\#LI\-GT1 \#LI\-HYBBRID

We’re looking for our next Fraud Investigator. Could it be you?
  
The Fraud team is accountable to proactively, comprehensively combat fraud for all of Questrade Financial Group to mitigate fraud and reputational risks while also helping Canadians become much more financially successful and secure.
  
The Fraud Investigator is responsible for investigating, documenting, and conducting root cause analyses on all Fraud types at Questrade Financial Group, through investigative techniques to strengthen Fraud capabilities for all products and services across the enterprise.
  
The Fraud Investigator is expected to conduct timely and accurate reviews of various fraud types on Flexiti’s portfolio and to ensure alerts and investigations are evaluated, documented, managed and escalated appropriately by following the standard operating procedures.
  
The successful candidate will work closely with internal and external partners and directly with clients when conducting investigations.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading...
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
* Monitoring and analyzing various information provided through detection systems, tools, reports, or manually evaluating, investigating and determining based on the required actions
* Analyzing and processing Fraud / dispute cases while ensuring all internal service levels, policies and procedures are met
* Supporting the collection of evidence and information to be used for multiple purposes including incident reports/filings, loss prevention, litigation and criminal prosecution, management information and statistics, and process improvements
* Documenting actions and information found throughout the investigation to develop and maintain account/case files
* Engaging with clients through various communication channels to deliver an outstanding client experience helping our clients become much more financially successful and secure
* Educating \& providing advice to stakeholders and clients to meet their immediate security needs and providing tailored solutions to protect them and prevent fraud losses
* Promoting operational excellence within the department while balancing the need to conduct appropriate, thorough investigations
* Providing input and developing recommendations for process and customer service improvements.
* Maintaining productive relationships with all internal and external stakeholders
* Preparing reports, notifications and activity / case filings to upper management or as required
* Exercising judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems
* Staying abreast of financial crimes risk trends, relevant regulations and compliance standards
* Other duties or accountabilities as needed


So are YOU our next Fraud Investigator? You are, if you...
  
* Have 2\+ years of experience working in financial services, risk management, and/or financial crimes (i.e. AML, Fraud, etc.)
* Have excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Are self\-motivated, energetic, results\-oriented and committed to adding value to the organization
* Have strong analytical and problem solving skills with ability to approach data with the right questions and recognition of trends
* Can develop and use structured approaches to identify root causes and opportunities
* Understand the impact that your work has on the company and customer journey
* Possess in\-depth knowledge of risk and technology management as applied to fraud and/or criminal risk
* Are a critical, outside\-the\-box thinker


Additional kudos if you…
  
* Are Bilingual (English / French)
* Have knowledge of financial products, services, and processes
* Are a certified Fraud Examiner (CFE) or Certified Financial Crime Specialist (CFCS)


Additional Information…
  
* Operating hours are 8 am to 9 pm, Monday to Sunday
* Shifts will be scheduled 5 days per week, not exceeding 40 hours in total


Sounds like you? Click below to apply!
  
\#LI\-NP1
  
\#LI\-Hybrid

* Documenting actions and information found throughout the investigation to develop and maintain account/case files
* Engaging with clients through various communication channels to deliver an outstanding client experience helping our clients become much more financially successful and secure
* Educating \& providing advice to stakeholders and clients to meet their immediate security needs and providing tailored solutions to protect them and prevent fraud losses
* Promoting operational excellence within the department while balancing the need to conduct appropriate, thorough investigations
* Providing input and developing recommendations for process and customer service improvements.
* Maintaining productive relationships with all internal and external stakeholders
* Preparing reports, notifications and activity / case filings to upper management or as required
* Exercising judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems
* Staying abreast of financial crimes risk trends, relevant regulations and compliance standards
* Other duties or accountabilities as needed


So are YOU our next Fraud Investigator? You are, if you...
  
* Have 2\+ years of experience working in financial services, risk management, and/or financial crimes (i.e. AML, Fraud, etc.)
* Have excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Are self\-motivated, energetic, results\-oriented and committed to adding value to the organization
* Have strong analytical and problem solving skills with ability to approach data with the right questions and recognition of trends
* Can develop and use structured approaches to identify root causes and opportunities
* Understand the impact that your work has on the company and customer journey
* Possess in\-depth knowledge of risk and technology management as applied to fraud and/or criminal risk
* Are a critical, outside\-the\-box thinker


Additional kudos if you…
  
* Are Bilingual (English / French)
* Have knowledge of financial products, services, and processes
* Are a certified Fraud Examiner (CFE) or Certified Financial Crime Specialist (CFCS)


Additional Information…
  
* Operating hours are 8 am to 9 pm, Monday to Sunday
* Shifts will be scheduled 5 days per week, not exceeding 40 hours in total

We’re looking for our next Director, Strategy. Could It Be You?
  
The Director, Strategy will act as a lead architect of Questrade Financial Group’s future growth. In this high\-visibility role, you will be responsible for defining where we play and how we win. You will lead the evaluation of organic and inorganic growth opportunities, while simultaneously acting as an internal consultant to our business units to refine long\-term strategies.
  
Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
* Internal Strategy \& Advisory: Serve as a trusted strategic partner to business unit leaders, driving initiatives to enter new verticals, optimize growth frameworks, and solve critical operational bottlenecks.
* Value Creation \& Deal Execution: Champion a rigorous "Build vs. Buy vs. Partner" framework to maximize enterprise value. Lead the execution of complex transactions, from initial valuation through to due diligence and negotiation.
* Pipeline Development \& Sourcing: Proactively cultivate a pipeline of high\-potential acquisition targets and strategic partnerships across the North American fintech landscape that accelerate Questrade’s ecosystem expansion.
* Financial Modeling \& Commercial Validation: Develop robust financial models and business cases to validate strategic initiatives. Translate complex financial data into clear investment recommendations for the Executive Committee.
* Cross\-Functional Program Leadership: Orchestrate cross\-functional teams (Product, Legal, Risk, Ops) to drive high\-priority strategic projects from ideation to execution, breaking down silos to ensure rapid delivery.
* Market Intelligence \& Foresight: Monitor the pulse of the fintech industry and macroeconomic trends. Provide the Board with forward\-looking insights on competitive threats, emerging technologies, and disruptive opportunities.
* Enterprise Strategic Planning: Facilitate the annual and long\-range planning cycles, collaborating with the C\-Suite to define corporate objectives (OKRs) and allocate resources against our highest\-leverage opportunities.


So are YOU our next Director, Strategy? You are if you…
  
* Have 8–12 years of total experience, with a minimum of 3–5 years in Investment Banking, Management Consulting, or Private Equity.
* Have experience in Financial Services (FIG) or Fintech.
* Have a strong understanding of the mechanics of banking and self\-directed investing.
* Have the ability to bring structure and rigor to ambiguous strategic problems
* Have exceptional communication skills
* Are a strategic and analytical thinker
* Have strong analytical capabilities with an outstanding attention to detail
* Have an ability to quickly assimilate large amounts of information; effectively comprehend, synthesize, analyze, structure and facilitate strategic decision making
* Have demonstrated experience working with and influencing cross\-functional teams in a collaborative manner
* Have solid business acuity, professionalism, and integrity
* Are a self\-starter with the ability to work independently and prioritize multiple competing initiatives
* Have sophisticated knowledge of Microsoft Office tools, particularly PowerPoint and Excel

We’re looking for a Director of Product Enablement. Could It Be You?
  
As the Director, Product Enablement, you will be a strategic operational leader responsible for driving product excellence and coordination across our high\-priority product lines, including Retail Everyday Banking, Unsecured Lending (Credit Cards, LoC), and Secured Lending (Mortgages). This role reports directly to the Head of Product and is immediately responsible for leading and scaling a dedicated Product Enablement team. You will be the central point of coordination and governance, optimizing the flow of work, data, and communication among Product Management, Engineering, Legal/Compliance, and Operations teams in a high\-growth Canadian Fintech environment.
  
Need more details? Keep reading…
  
The Director, Product Enablement will be responsible for three core pillars:
  
1\. Strategic Leadership \& Team Building
  
* Lead and grow the Product Enablement team, providing mentorship and structure to foster a culture of operational rigor and continuous improvement.
* Define, implement, and govern the end\-to\-end Product Development Lifecycle (PDLC), including standardized planning, OKR setting, and roadmap review processes.
* Manage the Product Operations budget, including oversight of vendor relationships and strategic input on spending for the product tech stack.


2\. Risk \& Regulatory Maturity
  
* Drive the maturation of the product compliance practice, designing and enforcing governance frameworks that embed complex Canadian regulatory requirements (e.g., OSFI, FINTRAC) directly into the development workflow.
* Establish mandatory risk assessment and audit\-readiness protocols, ensuring all new features, especially in Lending, meet regulatory standards prior to launch.
* Own the Launch Readiness (GTM) process, securing cross\-functional sign\-offs from Legal, Compliance, Marketing, and Operations to ensure successful and compliant product launches.


3\. Operational Excellence \& Tooling
  
* Own the Product Technology Stack (e.g., analytics, roadmapping, feedback tools), leading selection, implementation, and driving high user adoption across the organization.
* Establish and maintain a single source of truth for product performance, defining key metrics (KPIs) and building robust dashboards to inform executive and product decision\-making.
* Design and manage a rigorous customer feedback loop and intake process, ensuring qualitative and quantitative data is synthesized and prioritized by product teams.


So are YOU our next Director of Product Enablement? You are if you…
  
* Have 8\+ years of experience in Product Enablement, Product Management, or a similar strategic operational leadership role.
* Have 4\+ years of experience specifically within the Fintech, Digital Banking, or other highly regulated industry.
* Have demonstrable expertise in digital product lifecycles that require coordination across multiple stakeholders with regulatory accountability.
* Have Proven People Leadership experience, including hiring, managing, and scaling operational or technical teams.
* Have strong regulatory acumen with a track record of implementing compliance and risk controls into a product development environment, ideally within Canada.
* Have expertise in strategic product tooling selection and governance, with proven ability to leverage data to drive execution.
* Have deep experience developing and launching products in an Agile, Scrum, or Lean environment.


Additional kudos if you have…
  
* Experience at a high velocity venture backed startup.
* MBA or advanced degree in a related field.
* Experience launching products across multiple Canadian provinces or with inter\-provincial regulatory requirements

We’re looking for our next Compliance Officer, Business Integrity. Could It Be You?
  
The Compliance Officer, Business Integrity is primarily responsible for investigating escalated client complaints received by the Enterprise Business Integrity team, liaising with regulators and external reviewing bodies, and monitoring the resolution of any issues found during the complaints investigations. The Compliance Officer will also leverage new technologies including AI tools in order to increase the efficiency of assigned tasks.
  
Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
* Review escalated client's complaints in a fair, transparent, objective, and factual manner, and issue detailed written responses to clients.
* Ensure that regulatory timelines for complaints handling are consistently maintained.
* Maintain knowledge of the internal policies \& procedures, and external regulatory requirements of QFG’s various entities (including Questrade Inc, QWM, CTC, Questbank, Flexiti and Zolo).
* Identify, report, and monitor the resolution of any issue identified during the complaint investigations (such as process gaps, system limitations, coaching needs etc.).
* Identify and escalate any issue or trends to relevant parties.
* Ensure maintenance of complete records, providing a clear audit trail for complaints.
* Gather information requested by various regulators and prepare responses for review.
* Administer various compliance audits \& testing and prepare formal memorandums summarizing the results of such reviews.
* Provide support to the Manager \& Director, Business Integrity for reports to Senior Management and Compliance Committees.
* Provide guidance \& support to various business units with potential/confirmed complaints and other issues.
* Take ownership of processing and completing all tasks as assigned.
* Adapt to new technologies including leveraging AI to streamline investigations.
* Provide support and guidance to Compliance Analyst staff, where needed.
* Assist with the creation and deployment of training materials to other employees to foster a culture of compliance with consumer protection requirements.


So are YOU our next Compliance Officer, Business Integrity? You are if you…
  
* Have previous experience in a compliance, risk management or audit role.
* Have a post\-secondary degree/diploma in Business Administration / Commerce, Finance, Economics, Law or in a related field.
* Have strong knowledge of banking \& investment products.
* Have knowledge of retail securities trading and capital markets.
* Have the ability to make decisions independently based on available information.
* Have the ability to break down complex or multi\-dimensional problems, interpret and determine relevancy of information, and use reasoning to identify options and solutions.
* Have strong planning, organizational and time\-management skills \- including the ability to identify tasks and resources required to complete investigations within pre\-determined timelines.
* Have strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively and professionally with clients, internal and external stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
* Have the ability to understand and adapt to new technologies including leveraging AI to streamline investigations and other tasks.


Additional kudos if you…
  
* Have complete course/certifications such as Canadian Securities Course (CSC), Conduct and Practice Handbook Course (CPH), Derivatives Fundamental Course (DFC), Options License Course (OLC), Options Supervisor Course (OPSC), Branch Managers Course (BMC)
* Are Bilingual \- written and verbal fluency in English and French


Additional Information…
  
* Please note this role will be required to be in office 3 days a week


**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $75,000 \- $85,000
* The final compensation package will be commensurated with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.

We’re looking for our next Bilingual Client Sales \& Services Specialist (English/Mandarin). Could It Be You?
  
The Bilingual Client Sales \& Services Specialist (English/Mandarin) is responsible for addressing a wide range of client inquiries related to their Questrade accounts. This includes resolving account and transaction issues, providing in\-depth product knowledge, delivering technical support, and efficiently triaging complex matters. They also proactively contact clients to address account issues or provide follow\-up. This role requires flexibility to work rotating shifts, including early mornings, evenings, and weekends, with potential for overtime.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
  

**Client Interaction Management:**  

* Manage client interactions efficiently and effectively, from initial contact to resolution, across multiple channels (phone, email, chat, in\-person)
* Create service tasks and accurately record, sort and track problems and the resolution steps taken


**Problem Resolution and Support:**  

* Consult internal knowledge bases and resources to resolve client issues
* Reproduce and troubleshoot technical issues for Questrade products, including issues with connectivity, trade routing or order flow
* Quickly identify hardware, operating system and networking issues during client interactions
* Identify and escalate complex issues and potential problems in a timely manner
* Proactively contact clients to resolve account issues or provide follow\-up


**Product and Service Expertise:**  

* Become a subject matter expert for Questrade products, services, policies, and procedures
* Educate and support clients on Questrade’s various trading platforms
* Help update knowledge base by identifying and reporting issues
* Present value\-added solutions, including products, tools, and resources, to meet client needs


**Continuous Improvement and Development:**  

* Assist newer staff members in building their knowledge, productivity and quality skills
* Provide regular reporting on client interaction trends and identify opportunities for improvement
* Participate in 1:1 coaching, team meetings, and professional development workshops
* Keep up to date on all changes to Questrade products and services


So are YOU our next Bilingual Client Sales \& Services Specialist (English/Mandarin)? You are if you…
  
* Have strong written and verbal communication skills
* Are fully bilingual in English and Mandarin
* Have post\-secondary degree/diploma
* Have 6 months\-1 year related work experience
* Have flexibility to work rotating shifts, including evenings and weekends


Additional kudos if you…
  
* Have completed the Canadian Securities Course (CSC)
* Conduct and Practices Handbook Course (CPH)
* Derivatives Fundamentals and Options Licensing Course (DFOL)


Additional information…
  
* The shifts will be scheduled 5 days per week, not exceeding 40 hours in total; however the working hours/days of the week may fluctuate from one week to another.
* The shifts can be scheduled Mondays\-Fridays between 7:30 am\-8:30 pm (8\.5\-hour shift) and/or Saturdays \& Sundays from 10 am\-4 pm (6\-hour shift), including statutory holidays.
* Candidates located within a commutable distance to the office will be required to come into the office 3 days per week. Candidates located outside of the province will be able to work remotely.


**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $45,000 (Mandarin)
* The final compensation package will be commensurated with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.

We’re looking for our next Principal Software Engineer. Could It Be You?
  
  

The Principal Full Stack Engineer is a hands\-on technical leader who owns the design and delivery of complex systems within the squad’s portfolio. You will act as a force\-multiplier for your team, leading the execution of highly complex engineering tasks and proactively expanding your technical scope to drive broader impact across the platform.
  
  

Leveraging your expert knowledge of C\# .Net and Angular, you will drive technical excellence within your domain. You will support the Engineering Team Lead by setting high standards for innovation, mentoring engineers, and making key architectural decisions that ensure our digital investing platforms are scalable, performant, and robust.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
* Maintain ownership of systems within the squad’s portfolio, proactively expanding scope to drive broader technical impact. Lead the delivery of highly complex tasks, ensuring exceptional quality within expected timelines.
* Propose engineering solutions for highly complex systems within your domain. Collaborate with technical stakeholders on prototyping and research to influence the definition of solution architecture.
* Act as a technical leader within the team, performing highly complex engineering tasks while supporting the Engineering Team Lead and other engineers on implementation details.
* Troubleshoot and optimize solutions for highly complex issues. Apply expert knowledge to resolve performance bottlenecks in real\-time data streaming, database queries, and client\-side rendering.
* Define and execute complex test plans, including unit, integration, and performance tests. Ensure the team follows industry best practices for quality and automation.
* Stay up\-to\-date on industry trends and evaluate new technologies. Make decisions on localized system choices (e.g., library selection, code refactoring) within established frameworks and approved technologies.
* Set high standards for technical excellence and innovation. Mentor team members by reviewing code, sharing expertise, and guiding them through complex technical challenges.
* Collaborate closely with cross\-functional teams and subject matter experts (Product, Design) to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Foster a culture of collaboration and respect within the team.
* Clearly explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non\-technical teammates. Write clear and concise documentation, code comments, and design proposals. Present technical updates and project outcomes to the team and immediate stakeholders.


So are YOU our next Principal Software Engineer? You are if you…
  
* BS or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Systems Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent combination of education and experience).
* 8\+ years of professional software development experience, with a proven track record of shipping successful, large\-scale full stack applications.
* Expertise in one or more modern backend programming languages (e.g., C\#, Java, Go, Python, Node.js).
* Proven experience architecting and building scalable RESTful and WebSocket APIs.
* Deep understanding and application of object\-oriented programming (OOP), SOLID principles, and other software design patterns.
* Mastery of event\-driven architecture and message queues (e.g., PubSub, Kafka, RabbitMQ).
* Expert knowledge of Angular for web. Mastery of JavaScript/TypeScript and modern frontend ecosystems.
* Experience with React Native or mobile development is considered a strong asset (Nice to Have).
* Expert knowledge of engineering principles and strong knowledge of multiple architectural patterns. Applied experience leveraging development and QA tools, frameworks, and testing methodologies.
* Strong experience with SQL and NoSQL databases and cloud providers (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
* Ability to exceptionally perform and lead others on highly complex engineering tasks by applying or researching best solutions.
* Ability to take the lead on highly complex tasks with assistance from other engineers. Proven experience acting as a technical reference and supporting team decision\-making.
* Strong ability to document technical solutions and lead technical discussions within the team.
* Excellent analytical skills to troubleshoot highly complex issues and propose efficient engineering solutions.


**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $110,626 \- $138,282
* The final compensation package will be commensurate with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.

We’re looking for our next Principal QA Engineer. Could It Be You?
  
  

The Principal QA Engineer will architect the future of quality assurance at Questrade by researching, designing, and governing our next\-generation testing strategy. This role leads the selection and implementation of cutting\-edge technologies, with a strong focus on AI\-driven test automation and establishing robust, AI\-augmented quality frameworks. The ideal candidate is an expert engineer with deep experience in modern cloud\-native architectures and a passion for leveraging artificial intelligence to create smarter, more efficient, and more resilient testing solutions.
  
  

This role is directly responsible for providing strategic guidance, solution architecture, and technical leadership for agile teams, embedding a culture of intelligent quality.
  
  

The responsibilities of this position are to architect and implement AI\-augmented testing practices and technologies, including a self\-healing E2E test framework for Questrade's proprietary projects. This involves understanding complex business needs, directing teams in enhancing our applications, and establishing forward\-looking standards for software quality.
  
  

This position is a perfect fit for an innovative thinker who is passionate about applying AI to solve complex quality challenges and designing enterprise\-grade, future\-proof solutions.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
* Architect and implement a strategy for leveraging AI in the QA process, including AI\-driven test generation, visual regression, anomaly detection in test results, and predictive quality analytics.
* Govern the use of AI tools within the QA process, ensuring consistent application, reliability, and efficiency gains across all engineering teams.
* Provide leadership with feedback on the QA ecosystem and pioneer the adoption of new AI\-powered solutions to enhance quality and efficiency.
* Collaborate with technology teams to design resilient and testable software and AI systems from the ground up.
* Pursue and champion continuous learning across the organization regarding AI in testing, emerging technologies, and modern design patterns.
* Work closely with application developers to define holistic test strategies for new intelligent applications.
* Infuse DevOps practices with AI capabilities, improving the CI/CD pipeline with intelligent test selection, self\-healing scripts, and faster feedback loops.
* Perform code reviews for both application and test automation code, ensuring best practices for quality and maintainability.
* Track and support the prioritization of technical debt in regards to test automation and infrastructure.
* Collaborate with UI/UX designers, solution architects, and product owners to ensure quality is a key consideration throughout the entire development lifecycle.


So are YOU our next Principal QA Engineer? You are if you…
  
* Diverse Quality assurance Engineering and Quality leadership experience (7\+ years).
* Proven experience designing and implementing AI\-powered testing strategies or a deep understanding of AI testing tools (e.g., for test generation, self\-healing tests, visual validation).
* Expertise in one or more of the following: C\#, .NET Core, NodeJS, Javascript, Typescript, Selenium/Playwright, Docker, Kubernetes, SQL, gRPC, Event Brokers.
* Mastery in architecting and writing scalable, maintainable, and efficient test automation frameworks.
* Experience with building, testing, and deploying Docker images and a deep understanding of CI/CD concepts for microservices.
* Strong experience with Telemetry, Observability, and AIOps platforms.
* Proven success leading quality initiatives in cross\-functional agile teams.
* Experience with SQL Databases (e.g., MSSQL/MySQL) and NoSQL Databases (e.g., Cassandra, MongoDB).
* Expertise with Git, Jenkins, JIRA, Confluence.
* Extensive experience with major cloud providers \- GCP, AWS, Azure.
* Deep understanding of Event\-driven, streaming architectures, CQRS, etc.


**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $110,626 \- $138,282
* The final compensation package will be commensurated with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.
