We’re looking for our next Director, Accounting \& Financial Operations. Could it be you?
  
The Director, Accounting and Financial Operations will lead the accounting and financial operations for Questbank and CTC, reporting to the Corporate Controller. This vital leadership role within the Controllership and broader Finance team is accountable for ensuring the accurate and timely accounting for Questbank and CTC (Financial Regulated Financial Institutions or FRFIs).
  
Leading a team of nine, the Director will drive the implementation of efficient and well\-controlled accounting and financial processes, leveraging technology to ensure materially accurate financial results at all times. This role is also a key leader in finance enablement for Questbank and CTC initiatives, overseeing the accounting and financial operational requirements for enterprise projects. The Director will foster cross\-functional collaboration within the FRFIs and with QFG finance to achieve enterprise objectives, ensuring compliance with relevant rules, regulations, and IFRS, and maintaining a robust system of internal controls.
  
The Director will oversee complex accounting, implementation of new IFRS, implementation of financial processes to support new products and technology and ensure compliance with policies and regulations. In addition, the Director will be the key contact overseeing related party transactions between QB/CTC and other QFG entities (i.e. QTG, QE, FFI etc.)
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading...
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
People
  
* Developing and maintaining a skilled and effective accounting and financial operations function with an organizational design that supports control objectives and manages operational risks.
* Providing impactful leadership and coaching to the accounting and financial operations team and actively contributing as a key member of the broader finance leadership team.
* Leading the team to ensure robust controls, capture of meaningful data to inform business insights, and meet the requirements of relevant regulators (e.g., OSFI) and other stakeholders (e.g., FP\&A, reporting team, treasury, Executive).
* Fostering a culture of continuous improvement, professional development, and strong collaboration within the team and across the broader finance organization.


Accounting / GL
  
* Overseeing and managing the end\-to\-end comprehensive accounting operations, including product accounting (mortgages, deposits, credit cards, and new product launches), complex accounting, securitization, debt financing, hedge accounting, bank reconciliations, accounts payable, treasury support, related party transactions, project cost tracking, and corporate allocation tracking and reporting.
* Ensuring strict compliance with all relevant accounting standards and FRFI accounting policies, including International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) and other regulatory requirements from agencies like OSFI.
* Maintaining an optimized chart of accounts and Profit/Cost Centre hierarchy to support the diverse reporting needs of all stakeholders, including product level profitability.
* Managing and ensuring the accurate accounting for complex financial instruments, transactions and estimates, including derivatives, securitizations, fair values and expected credit losses.
* Leading the accounting operations impact assessment and facilitating the seamless implementation of new IFRS standards.


Processes / Internal Controls
  
* Implementing and continuously improving best\-in\-class business processes to streamline operations, enable company growth, and meet aggressive financial close timelines.
* Ensuring the team operates in full compliance with approved financial policies, procedures, and FRFI accounting policies, strictly adhering to the Board\-approved Risk Appetite.
* Developing, maintaining, restructuring, and enhancing robust internal controls and procedures to protect and safeguard the FRFI’s assets, scaling controls in line with the Board\-approved Internal Control Policy and meeting RCM and RCSA program expectations.
* Strategically contributing to the year\-end audit process, analyzing audit findings, and driving process improvements based on audit results.
* Overseeing the development and regular updating of comprehensive business recovery plans for accounting and financial operations.
* Collaborating effectively with internal audit to proactively addressing findings and implement timely corrective actions for any identified control deficiencies.
* Ensuring thorough documentation of all accounting and financial processes and controls to maintain continuous audit readiness.


Projects / Technology
  
* Managing the financial systems supporting accounting and financial operations across the FRFIs, including Netsuite, Procurity, Gatekeeper, Kyriba, and Blackline, ensuring maximum productivity to meet current and future business needs.
* Driving enhanced utilization of Blackline for optimized workflow management and reconciliations.
* Leading the accounting and financial operations enablement for enterprise initiatives and new product launches, including the Temenos implementation, encompassing business requirements definition, solution integration and testing.
* Driving enhanced automation and integration of financial systems, actively supporting the development of a centralized finance data lake and acting as a data steward for critical finance data.
* Ensuring effective utilization of all finance\-related technologies available at QFG, maximizing technology leverage by every team member to ensure scalability, efficiency, and stringent internal control.
* Acting as primary liaison for Finance in ensuring data and corresponding reports from source systems (Transact, PowerCARD, LOS/LMS, Portfolio Plus) are accurate and suitable for Financial reporting needs. Raise any identified issues/risks to appropriate Technology teams for swift remediation.


So are YOU our next Director, Accounting \& Financial Operations? You are if you…
  
* Hold a professional accounting designation (CPA\-CA)
* Have 5\+ years of progressive leadership experience within a Financial Regulated Financial Institution (FRFI) or equivalent relevant experience
* Have 10\+ years of comprehensive finance and accounting experience
* Have in\-depth knowledge of International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS), with specialized expertise in IFRS 9 and hedge accounting
* Have solid understanding of the regulatory framework and reporting requirements pertinent to FRFIs
* Have superior comprehension of financial statements, including the income statement, balance sheet, and cash flow dynamics specific to deposit\-taking institutions
* Have advanced proficiency in leveraging technology to enhance accounting operations, with a strong interest in utilizing emerging financial technologies for competitive advantage and cost management
* Possess exceptional attention to detail, coupled with the strategic ability to assess impacts on the consolidated entity
* Have a proven track record of successful participation in and execution of complex projects within finance and across cross\-functional teams
* Have demonstrated ability to proactively identify issues, take initiative, and develop effective solutions
* Have strong critical thinking skills applied to business issues, consistently driving impactful results
* Have the ability to excel both independently and collaboratively within a team environment
* Exhibit a positive, proactive, and solutions\-oriented approach, employing creative methods to solve complex problems
* Serve as a strong team player who actively motivates others towards collective success and demonstrates a clear sense of ownership for projects and initiatives
* Proactively establish and cultivate healthy, collaborative working relationships with team members and peers
* Utilize open communication and effective collaboration as primary tools for problem\-solving and managing deliverables
* Thrive in a dynamic and fast\-paced environment, demonstrating a strong ability to navigate organizational change with composure and adaptability, with proven ability to handle stress patiently and deliberately

We’re looking for our next Senior Service Designer. Could It Be You?
  
We’re looking for a Senior Service Designer to help us reimagine how we deliver value to our customers and colleagues. If you’re excited by complexity, motivated by real outcomes, and passionate about connecting rigorous research with meaningful design, this role is for you.
  
Apply through the link sending us your resume plus your portfolio that showcases your process, impact, and outcomes. We’re not just looking for polished deliverables, we want to see how you got there and achieved.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
As a Senior Service Designer, you’ll lead projects that span through discovery, design, and delivery phases. You’ll bring clarity to messy problems, shape strategies grounded in evidence, and translate them into actionable improvements across digital, human, and physical touchpoints, as well as organizational structures.
  
  

**You will:**  

* Lead end\-to\-end service design projects: framing opportunities, conducting research, mapping journeys, prototyping, and influencing the shape of roadmaps.
* Work closely with product management, design, research, backoffice, and customer service teams to influence product and service improvements.
* Design and execute research (qualitative \+ quantitative) that surfaces customer and employee needs, tests hypotheses, and validates solutions.
* Make the invisible visible through frameworks like journey maps, service blueprints, and ecosystem maps that align teams around a shared view of the problem and the path forward.
* Facilitate collaboration: run workshops, co\-design sessions, and alignment forums that bring stakeholders, customers, and cross\-functional teams together.
* Translate insights into impact by shaping service strategies, experience principles, and operational improvements.
* Advocate for both customers and organizational needs, ensuring solutions balance desirability, feasibility, and viability.
* Mentor and support other designers, raising the craft and culture of service design at QFG.
* Build strong working relationships with product teams and delivery partners.


So are YOU our next Senior Service Designer? You are if you have…
  
* 5 years of professional experience in service design, strategic design, or related fields (consultancies, in\-house teams, or agencies).
* A portfolio that shows end\-to\-end service design and research excellence, from framing and insight generation to strategy and delivery.
* Strong skills in user research methods (interviews, contextual inquiry, diary studies, usability testing, surveys) and synthesis into actionable insights.
* Fluency with service design methods and tools (journey maps, personas, service blueprints, systems maps, service prototypes).
* Workshop design and facilitation expertise: you know how to guide groups through problem framing, ideation, prioritization, and alignment.
* Clear, compelling storytelling and communication skills, able to influence at senior levels and be an evangelist of the value of service design.
* Comfort working in complex, multi\-stakeholder environments even when facing ambiguity due to early exploration stages, varied stakeholder needs, or data availability.


Kudos if…
  
  

* Experience shaping or scaling new services, products, or businesses.
* Exposure to data\-informed design (basic statistical analysis, behavioral analytics, experimentation).
* Working knowledge of modern design, research, journey mapping/ops, and user analytics tools as:
* (e.g., Miro, TheyDo, Figma, UserTesting, Amplitude).


**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $100,000 \- $150,000
* The final compensation package will be commensurate with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.

We’re looking for our next Director, Operational Risk \& Resilience. Could It Be You?
  
Reporting to the Chief Risk Officer, the Director, Operational Risk \& Resilience will be primarily responsible for leading and enhancing the Operational Risk Management program at Community Trust Company, in compliance with OSFI regulatory requirements.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
* Design, implement and manage the operational risk management programs including fraud risk management, business continuity management, IT and cyber risk management, third party risk management and overall operational risk management.
* Establish an operational risk appetite and implement a process to ensure the Company manages within it and has the ability to identify and manage any exceptions
* Manage and chair the Operational Risk Committee, and attend as a key member of other senior management committees
* Ensure the design and operating effectiveness of each of the operational risk management programs is sufficient given the risk of the business, and ensure they meet and continue to comply with the expectations set out in respective OSFI Guidelines
* Support the CRO for all operational risk matters with the Board and Committees
* Support the CRO for all operational risk matters with OSFI
* Manage strong working relationships with business partners, including other control functions
* Provide leadership, training, motivation, coaching and evaluation to the operational risk team and the broader company on operational risk matters


So are YOU our next Director, Operational Risk \& Resilience? You are if you…
  
* Have a University degree in a business related field
* Have 10\+ years of operational risk management experience as part of the second line of defense in an OSFI regulated institution preferred. Combinations of experience in fraud risk management, business continuity management, IT and cyber risk management, third party risk management and overall operational risk management
* Have strong business acumen and knowledge of principles, techniques, current trends, best practices, regulations, policies, and programs related to risk management
* Have 10\+ years of people management experience is preferred
* Have a desire for high performance and ability to make an impact
* Have a solutions\-oriented mindset, critical thinking and sound decision making
* Have strong collaboration, influencing, conflict resolution and stakeholder relationship building and people and process management skills
* Have proven ability to manage multiple deliverables with firm deadlines
* Have excellent written communication skills – the ability to articulate key messages concisely and effectively
* Have experience writing policies
* Have experience creating reports for senior management
* Have proficiency with Microsoft Office, Google Suite, Power BI, RPA advantageous
* Bring a positive, can\-do attitude to our organization, using creative solutions to solve problems.
* Are a strong team player who motivates others to achieve group success.
* Can establish and build on healthy working relationships with your team and peers.
* Use open communication and collaboration to solve problems and manage deliverables.
* Work well in a dynamic and fast paced environment with the ability to navigate through organizational change.


Additional Information…
  
* Please note this role will be required to be in office 3 days a week

We’re looking for our next Specialist Frontend Software Developer. Could It Be You?
  
This is a unique opportunity to leverage your deep expertise in frontend engineering to lead technical innovation in the rapidly evolving world of cryptocurrency and new trading products, driving our technological evolution.
  
  

As a Principal Frontend Engineer specializing in Crypto and Alternative Trading Products at Questrade, you will be a technical leader shaping the future of our digital asset and alternatives offerings. You'll take ownership of the frontend architecture for our retail crypto and alternatives trading platforms, guide the expansion of our crypto capabilities, and lead the launch of new alternative trading products.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**Platform Architecture \& Development:** Architect, design, and lead the development of robust, scalable, and secure frontend applications for Questrade's retail crypto and alternatives trading platforms, establishing best practices and technical standards.
  
**Technical Leadership:** Drive the technical strategy for expanding crypto infrastructure across various Questrade products, ensuring seamless integration, high performance, and future scalability.
  
**New Product Launches:** Lead the frontend development and launch of new crypto capabilities for clients and internal teams, from architectural design to deployment, with a focus on technical excellence and quality.
  
**Growth Portfolio Innovation:** Lead the architecture, build, and delivery of other new alternative trading products within the dedicated Growth Portfolio entity, actively identifying, vetting, and adopting emerging technologies.
  
**Operational Excellence:** Provide expert\-level support for all crypto trading and transfer solutions, mentoring the team on troubleshooting complex issues and ensuring system stability and reliability.
  
**API Integration Strategy:** Define the strategy for integrating with internal and external APIs (including RESTful and WebSocket APIs), ensuring long\-term maintainability and performance.
  
**Team Leadership \& Mentorship:** Lead and mentor a team of frontend engineers, fostering a culture of continuous improvement, knowledge sharing, and adoption of innovative development practices. Set the technical standards for the team.
  
**Efficiency \& Automation:** Champion initiatives to automate workflows, optimize system performance, and enhance development pipelines to boost team efficiency and accelerate delivery cycles.
  
**Complex Problem Solving:** Own the diagnosis and resolution of the most complex technical issues, ensuring high availability and optimal performance of crypto and trading systems.
  
**Cross\-functional Collaboration:** Act as a key technical liaison, working closely with product owners, backend architects, and other stakeholders to translate business requirements into cutting\-edge, scalable technical solutions.
  
**Research \& Innovation:** Actively research, prototype, and champion the adoption of new trends and technologies in the blockchain and cryptocurrency space to maintain our competitive edge.
  
So are YOU our next Specialist Frontend Software Developer? You are if you have…
  
* Expertise in Angular and React Native is desired.
* Proven experience integrating common crypto platform vendors (hot wallets, custodians, execution management service, payment processors).
* Deep experience in the financial services or FinTech industry.
* Expert knowledge of security best practices in blockchain and financial applications.
* Demonstrated experience leading the launch of new products from 0 to 1\.


Experience with backend technologies (e.g., C\#, Java, Go, Python, Node.js) is a strong bonus.
  
* Experience: 3\-5\+ years of experience in frontend software development, with a proven track record of architecting and building large\-scale, resilient user interfaces.


**Technical Proficiency:**  

* Expertise in multiple frontend web frameworks (e.g., Angular, React, VUE).
* Extensive experience architecting and building highly interactive, responsive, and performant web and mobile applications.
* Deep understanding and application of object\-oriented programming (OOP), SOLID principles, and other software design patterns.
* Proven experience designing and implementing microfrontend architectures.
* Expertise in consuming and designing contracts for RESTful and WebSocket APIs.
* Mastery of state management libraries and patterns at scale.
* Experience leading testing strategies and implementing robust unit, integration, and performance testing practices (e.g., Jest, Mira, Cypress).
* Working experience with cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, Azure, AWS) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).


**System Design:** Proven ability to architect complex, high\-availability frontend systems with a focus on performance, security, and maintainability.
  
**Problem\-Solving Skills:** Exceptional analytical and problem\-solving abilities, with a talent for resolving ambiguous and complex technical challenges.
  
**Communication:** Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical strategy to technical and non\-technical audiences, including leadership.
  
**Collaboration \& Leadership:** A strong leader and team player who excels in a collaborative environment and has a passion for mentoring and elevating the skills of the team.
  
**Initiative:** A self\-starter with a strategic mindset and a relentless drive to deliver high\-quality solutions and push technological boundaries.
  
**Education:** Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience. A Master's degree is a plus.
  
  

**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $105,000 \- $140,000
* The final compensation package will be commensurate with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.

**Growth Portfolio Innovation:** Lead the architecture, build, and delivery of other new alternative trading products within the dedicated Growth Portfolio entity, actively identifying, vetting, and adopting emerging technologies.
  
**Operational Excellence:** Provide expert\-level support for all crypto trading and transfer solutions, mentoring the team on troubleshooting complex issues and ensuring system stability and reliability.
  
**API Integration Strategy:** Define the strategy for integrating with internal and external APIs (including RESTful and WebSocket APIs), ensuring long\-term maintainability and performance.
  
**Team Leadership \& Mentorship:** Lead and mentor a team of frontend engineers, fostering a culture of continuous improvement, knowledge sharing, and adoption of innovative development practices. Set the technical standards for the team.
  
**Efficiency \& Automation:** Champion initiatives to automate workflows, optimize system performance, and enhance development pipelines to boost team efficiency and accelerate delivery cycles.
  
**Complex Problem Solving:** Own the diagnosis and resolution of the most complex technical issues, ensuring high availability and optimal performance of crypto and trading systems.
  
**Cross\-functional Collaboration:** Act as a key technical liaison, working closely with product owners, backend architects, and other stakeholders to translate business requirements into cutting\-edge, scalable technical solutions.
  
**Research \& Innovation:** Actively research, prototype, and champion the adoption of new trends and technologies in the blockchain and cryptocurrency space to maintain our competitive edge.
  
So are YOU our next Specialist Frontend Software Developer? You are if you have…
  
* Expertise in Angular and React Native is desired.
* Proven experience integrating common crypto platform vendors (hot wallets, custodians, execution management service, payment processors).
* Deep experience in the financial services or FinTech industry.
* Expert knowledge of security best practices in blockchain and financial applications.
* Demonstrated experience leading the launch of new products from 0 to 1\.


Experience with backend technologies (e.g., C\#, Java, Go, Python, Node.js) is a strong bonus.
  
* Experience: 3\-5\+ years of experience in frontend software development, with a proven track record of architecting and building large\-scale, resilient user interfaces.


**Technical Proficiency:**  

* Expertise in multiple frontend web frameworks (e.g., Angular, React, VUE).
* Extensive experience architecting and building highly interactive, responsive, and performant web and mobile applications.
* Deep understanding and application of object\-oriented programming (OOP), SOLID principles, and other software design patterns.
* Proven experience designing and implementing microfrontend architectures.
* Expertise in consuming and designing contracts for RESTful and WebSocket APIs.
* Mastery of state management libraries and patterns at scale.
* Experience leading testing strategies and implementing robust unit, integration, and performance testing practices (e.g., Jest, Mira, Cypress).
* Working experience with cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, Azure, AWS) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).


**System Design:** Proven ability to architect complex, high\-availability frontend systems with a focus on performance, security, and maintainability.
  
**Problem\-Solving Skills:** Exceptional analytical and problem\-solving abilities, with a talent for resolving ambiguous and complex technical challenges.
  
**Communication:** Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical strategy to technical and non\-technical audiences, including leadership.
  
**Collaboration \& Leadership:** A strong leader and team player who excels in a collaborative environment and has a passion for mentoring and elevating the skills of the team.
  
**Initiative:** A self\-starter with a strategic mindset and a relentless drive to deliver high\-quality solutions and push technological boundaries.
  
**Education:** Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience. A Master's degree is a plus.
  
  

**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $105,000 \- $140,000
* The final compensation package will be commensurate with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.

description:
Questrade Financial Group (QFG), through its companies \- Questrade, Inc., Questrade Wealth Management Inc., Community Trust Company, Zolo, and Flexiti Financial Inc., provides securities and foreign currency investment, professionally managed investment portfolios, mortgages, real estate services, financial services and more. Questrade uses cutting\-edge technologies to develop innovative products that give customers better, more affordable ways to take control of their money.
  
  

We are everything a traditional financial institution is not. At QFG, you will be constantly moving forward, bringing the future of fintech into existence. You will be a part of a collaborative team that cares deeply about our mission and each other. Your team members will help you conquer challenges, push boundaries and discover what you are truly capable of.
  
  

At QFG, we have a culture of innovation where technology serves people—both our team and our customers. We see AI as a collaborative and transformative enabler, and we are seeking forward\-thinking individuals who can effectively integrate it into their daily work. The ideal candidate will be a catalyst for change, helping us use AI to create a more efficient and rewarding employee experience while also developing cutting\-edge solutions that delight and serve our customers. Join us in shaping a future where AI empowers our team to do their best work and helps us deliver unparalleled customer experiences.
  
  

This is a place where you can explore, discover and learn with continuous growth. As a diverse and inclusive place to work, with a hybrid working environment you can unleash your creativity and curiosity with no limits. If you share the same sense of infinite possibility, come shape your future at QFG.
  
  

What’s in it for you as an employee of QFG?
  
* Health \& wellbeing resources and programs
* Paid vacation, personal, and sick days for work\-life balance
* Competitive compensation and benefits packages
* Work\-life balance
* Career growth and development opportunities
* Opportunities to contribute to community causes
* Work with diverse team members in an inclusive and collaborative environment


We’re looking for our next Senior Service Designer. Could It Be You?
  
We’re looking for a Senior Service Designer to help us reimagine how we deliver value to our customers and colleagues. If you’re excited by complexity, motivated by real outcomes, and passionate about connecting rigorous research with meaningful design, this role is for you.
  
Apply through the link sending us your resume plus your portfolio that showcases your process, impact, and outcomes. We’re not just looking for polished deliverables, we want to see how you got there and achieved.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
As a Senior Service Designer, you’ll lead projects that span through discovery, design, and delivery phases. You’ll bring clarity to messy problems, shape strategies grounded in evidence, and translate them into actionable improvements across digital, human, and physical touchpoints, as well as organizational structures.
  
  

**You will:**  

* Lead end\-to\-end service design projects: framing opportunities, conducting research, mapping journeys, prototyping, and influencing the shape of roadmaps.
* Work closely with product management, design, research, backoffice, and customer service teams to influence product and service improvements.
* Design and execute research (qualitative \+ quantitative) that surfaces customer and employee needs, tests hypotheses, and validates solutions.
* Make the invisible visible through frameworks like journey maps, service blueprints, and ecosystem maps that align teams around a shared view of the problem and the path forward.
* Facilitate collaboration: run workshops, co\-design sessions, and alignment forums that bring stakeholders, customers, and cross\-functional teams together.
* Translate insights into impact by shaping service strategies, experience principles, and operational improvements.
* Advocate for both customers and organizational needs, ensuring solutions balance desirability, feasibility, and viability.
* Mentor and support other designers, raising the craft and culture of service design at QFG.
* Build strong working relationships with product teams and delivery partners.


So are YOU our next Senior Service Designer? You are if you have…
  
* 5 years of professional experience in service design, strategic design, or related fields (consultancies, in\-house teams, or agencies).
* A portfolio that shows end\-to\-end service design and research excellence, from framing and insight generation to strategy and delivery.
* Strong skills in user research methods (interviews, contextual inquiry, diary studies, usability testing, surveys) and synthesis into actionable insights.
* Fluency with service design methods and tools (journey maps, personas, service blueprints, systems maps, service prototypes).
* Workshop design and facilitation expertise: you know how to guide groups through problem framing, ideation, prioritization, and alignment.
* Clear, compelling storytelling and communication skills, able to influence at senior levels and be an evangelist of the value of service design.
* Comfort working in complex, multi\-stakeholder environments even when facing ambiguity due to early exploration stages, varied stakeholder needs, or data availability.


Kudos if…
  
  

* Experience shaping or scaling new services, products, or businesses.
* Exposure to data\-informed design (basic statistical analysis, behavioral analytics, experimentation).
* Working knowledge of modern design, research, journey mapping/ops, and user analytics tools as:
* (e.g., Miro, TheyDo, Figma, UserTesting, Amplitude).


**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $100,000 \- $150,000
* The final compensation package will be commensurate with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.

We’re looking for our next Senior Manager, Growth Marketing. Could It Be You?
  
The Senior Manager, Growth Marketing role is critical in designing and executing top\-of\-funnel acquisition strategies for the future state bank entity, directly supporting our efforts to bring new banking products to the market. You'll lead the acquisition roadmap, ensuring a seamless go\-to\-market strategy. Responsibilities include working with agencies on best\-in\-class creatives, managing campaign launches, pacing, and delivery to meet KPIs, and overseeing the bank website to optimize the user journey from ad exposure to conversion. You'll also develop acquisition offer strategies, collaborating closely with the Insights \& Analytics team and maintaining a holistic view of campaigns for cohesive customer experience.
  
  

Need more details? Keep reading…
  
**In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
  
  

**Acquisition Strategy \& Execution:**  

* Develop and evolve the go\-to\-market acquisition strategy to ensure successful launches for our first banking products and all future feature rollouts.
* Designs strategies for growth and full\-funnel performance across all acquisition channels (i.e., SEO, search, paid media, referrals, website etc.).
* Develops acquisitions offer strategies to generate and convert leads.
* Define and implement a holistic strategy encompassing all paid channels for campaigns/product launches in the market, both offline and online.
* Creates briefs and works with agencies to deliver best\-in\-class creatives.
* Translate marketing and business goals into actionable media campaigns with a two\-pronged focus on brand building and lead acquisition.
* Align with the Product Marketing team on high\-priority audience segments and strategize how to reach them most effectively.
* Collaborate with Growth Media lead within each entity to ensure media best practices are managed at an enterprise level.
* Optimize channels to maximize allocation of marketing budget and drive efficiencies.
* Analyze campaign results across paid and organic channels and report on performance, actionable insights \& learnings to all stakeholders on a timely basis.
* Manage the Media Budget and Media Plans to support decisions around tactics and budget allocation to drive acquisition.
* Monitor the competitive landscape, identify trends, formulate insights, and provide regular recommendations to drive continuous improvement in our acquisition efforts.
* Work closely with internal stakeholders to ensure all objectives are being met and transparency is available for all current projects.


**Performance Monitoring \& Optimization:**  

* Defines, drives, and leverages data and analytics to optimize media performance across all acquisition channels.
* Monitor attribution and analytics, with a focus on business KPIs.
* Build the measurement strategy of media campaigns across relevant platforms and channels.
* Develop tagging specifications to support media measurement and optimization strategies.


**Bank Website Ownership:**  

* Manage and oversee bank website, responsible for updating content and optimizing placements.
* Identify, test and learn initiatives to drive lead generation and enhance customer experience.
* Brief external and internal partners on technical requirements for the website


So are YOU our next Senior Manager, Growth Marketing? You are if you…
  
* Have 8\+ years of digital acquisition experience (platform media planning and buying experience is considered an asset)
* Have a clear understanding of all different acquisition channels and their role within the customer journey
* Have experience in developing strategies for paid media campaigns which are a part of bigger multi\-channel initiatives
* Have experience working with different reporting platforms (e.g. Google Analytics, Amplitude)
* Have the ability to think strategically and drive solid results to grow the business
* Have a strong data analytics and strategy background
* Have the ability to identify, document and communicate insights and recommendations
* Have hands on experience in digital marketing project management
* Take ownership of tasks and drives projects through to completion
* Are a reliable self\-starter with attention to detail and passion for quality
* Have strong interpersonal, problem\-solving and decision\-making skills
* Have an insatiable curiosity and a constant drive to learn and improve
* Are up to date with all emerging digital trends and issues


Additional kudos if you…
  
* Have previous experience in financial services
* Have experience working with platforms including Google and Meta (Microsoft Ads, Reddit Ads, TikTok Ads, DV360 experience is considered an asset)
* Have worked on large marketing accounts with multiple LOBs
* Have Ad Operations Skills \- tagging, troubleshooting, etc.


Additional Information…
  
* Please note this role will be required to be in office 3 days a week


**Compensation Information:**  

* Base salary range: $135,000 \- $170,000
* The final compensation package will be commensurated with the successful candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location (Canada). It includes a comprehensive benefits plan and a competitive incentive (bonus) program for Full\-Time Permanent roles.
